PTxXnndRRC7jUa24s2EyYw.text: Excellent Customer Service..superb sushi and yummy entrees..the restaurant is very clean and very inviting..the prices are fair market.  I would highly recommend this restaurant

zgIi41yMm-spnbJZZgl8Bw.text: First time trying this place and it was phenomenal! Highly recommend anyone that wants very good Korean BBQ to give it a try, you will not be disappointed.    We ordered the #38 chapchae, #47 beef bulgogi dukbaegi (my personal favorite), #68 soon-tofu and #70 galbi-tang.   The servers were all very attentive and checked in on us often to see if we needed anything.  At the end of the meal we were served a sweet cold drink which was just the perfect way to cap off a wonderful meal.  Will definitely come back and often.

dE9K8gWYsXkRNVmOHEVpbA.text: This is the BEST Korean BBQ spot in town! The decor, on point! The music, pleasent. The waite staff, PHENOMENAL! They made dinner an outstanding experience! They were very knowledgeable and charming. Most of all they were incredibly helpful. Oh and the food is absolutely Delicious!!! There is a wide variety of dishes and many helpful pictures for those new to Korean cuisine. The presentation of the food when served is beautiful! You will definitely have an array of Instagram likes and comments. I'm excited to go back!

t3PdvrHfKuPJGAajFzhdcA.text: The service was great! You push the call button and one of the wait staff will be at your table very quickly. The restaurant and restrooms are very nice and well maintained. As far as the food goes, nothing was amazing, but nothing was horrible either. We did not try the BBQ, and might consider going back to try that sometime. We did try the Yuk-Gae-Jang and the Dragon Roll, Hawaiian Roll, Wildfire Roll, and California Tempura. We felt that everything was a little overpriced and we know better sushi spots with cheaper prices.

D6UVbD7ipyoArH7PyTpegw.text: -First if all this place looks amazing inside, one if the nicest looking Korean restaurants I've ever been to.  -Prices are very high in comparison to other Korean restaurants. -Best home made dumplings, highly recommended. -Sushi was ok, a little fishy. -They do not skimp on side dishes and bring out a lot. -Management is friendly and come check on you -Staff is not trained too well as both times I've been here they couldn't answer questions about the menu.

NqCq1jNQ7k-uQiYiwG4ddQ.text: Amazing service and AMAZING food and drinks. Was really surprised by the fast service considering how busy it looked. Our server Sally was great! Definitely recommend the Asian Mule or the Lagoon Bunch Punch! Will be coming again my next time in Phoenix.

8L1YuAeWKEtPNKUVzJhXhQ.text: Found my favorite korean restaurant in Phoenix. Not only the food are delicious but the servers are extremely friendly. The lady that serve us found out that its my birthday today and she gave me icecream mochi for dessert. I already liked her from the beginning and I appreciate her even more. Also, unlike other restaurants, they serve so quick that i was surprised. Highly recommend this place.

hmu_omGTl8ZY5BnEbOzn_w.text: As you can tell by all of the amazing review, Seoul BBQ is a MUST TRY. Me and my boyfriend came here on his last night here before he left to go back home to Chicago. I am so glad I chose this place. The food had so much quality and authenticity . The meat was awesome, which honestly, is hard to find around the Phoenix area. Also, the sides were so delicious. Customer service was way over the top. Our server Johnathan was so personable, he had me and my boyfriend laughing none stop. AND!! to top it off, the owners are from the Chicago. There was an instant connection. Me loving Korean BBQ and my boyfriend being from Chicago and now his new found love for Korean BBQ. This place is definitely on the top of my list to return to. TRUST ME. Thank you Albert for all the tips and advice from food to travel and beyond. I will definitely be back here, thinking about going for a team night with my co workers. That's how much I would like to rave about this place!

JLi_BRizJ0TgrDCDFee1uA.text: I've just had one of the best meals of my life.  The Kalbi short rib soup had a rich, slightly sweet broth filled with chunks of hearty meat that melted in my mouth.   The soup also had these wonderful dumplings, mushrooms, Vegetables and even a little Chestnut. Served with 14 side dishes and rice, there was plenty for a second meal to take home.   Every server in the place stopped by multiple times to see how I was. It was like they were celebrating with me.

fT3FxqbrF1PCTBPHljjPVQ.text: This place is amazing! I was craving Korean food since moving from LA and out of all the k-bbq and other Korean restaurants in the Phoenix/Mesa area, I found Seoulphx has the most authentic, quality dishes around! I nearly cried, it was like eating my grandmother's cooking, except it was elevated to culinary refinement that isn't even found consistently at Korean food establishments in Koreatown. I've been here twice, both times when I felt really and left feeling so nourished!

iS3CU4PyB1eh9jCdTDYAOA.text: I'm from California where there is definitely not a shortage of Korean bbq/restaurants. Verdict? I'd probably rate it  2.5 stars if it were possible and most likely won't return.  Food: Pretty pricey. My fiance's grandpa got the beef bibimbap and my fiance and I shared the beef bulgogi--good portion and the right amount of tender, but for the price, other places are comparable in taste for cheaper.  Atmosphere: tons of seating and looked like there was even a private room you can rent out. Clean/spacious overall.  Service: this was the downfall for me. While the servers were very friendly, I went here with my fiance's grandpa and uncle who have never had Korean bbq and inevitably had questions. The servers unfortunately couldn't answer any of the questions we had about the menu.   Between the price and the service, in the future I'd go elsewhere to get my Korean bbq fix.

-CXbox2wV42inrDkSrlTKw.text: Got the bulgogi and the spicy pork, both were excellent! There was so much banchan, I was in heaven. Wait staff was so nice and helpful. Restaurant was very clean (which isn't always the case at Korean BBQ places) and decor was great. Will definitely be coming back. My only gripe is the meat is a bit more expensive for the portion size, but it was great quality and wasn't grisly. A must try!!!

mfMKjVucSclKJxZzExVQOw.text: Love this authentic Korean restaurant that offers a variety of quality dishes! We're from Los Angeles and have tried the most popular Korean BBQ restaurants in LA but this place is by far the BEST! We loved their friendly service, the ambience and most importantly, their food. The 16 side dishes alone can satisfy your palate. Such a feast and fine dining experience we had at Seoul BBQ and Sushi. My wife and daughter enjoyed their fresh sashimi and sushi rolls (especially rainbow rolls) while my son and I savored mouthwatering Galbi, grilled beef brisket, Naengmyeon, and many more. We loved their deep fried dumpling and chicken wings as appetizers.  While staying in AZ, we've gone back several times because of our great dining experience. Try their spicy Chilean sea bass soup and the stuffed boiled Cornish hen with ginseng and vegetables soup. Wow! We wish they can open a restaurant in LA, too.

5MzhU2egA9QHlOk-X8whyQ.text: Top notch authentic quality Korean BBQ on par with some of the best places I've had in LA, NY and SF.  Surprisingly, the sushi is also exceptional and something you don't always see in Korean BBQ establishments.  I would say the sushi alone is on par with high end sushi restaurants.  The restaurant itself looks brand new with many private rooms or open seating.  Nice bar and sushi bar sections as well so there seemed to be many options depending on your party.  Great service and the owner often stopped by to check on you and was very friendly and accommodating.  Interestingly, I saw they had photos of many of the LPGA Korean golfers frequent the establishment when in town for the the LPGA tournament in March which wasn't surprising.  Highly recommend.

8Bfty_vWYYCUl5Bo3BKjZg.text: Good Korean bbq and the sushi I good too , great atmosphere ,table button service , fast , efficient, correct orders .  When I feel the need for Korean food , this is where I go , happy hour and drink specials. Really close to my pad

441f68gFoNdxULto6QRjFA.text: On a whim, my wife and I decided to go out to lunch. We were headed to Pappadeaux's when Seoul BBQ & Sushi caught our eye. We frequent Pappadeaux's often and this was the first time we noticed. There weren't many cars there, and we drove around looking to make sure it was even open. We decided to double back and give it a try. From the front door, the hostess was so incredibly nice and sincere with her welcome. As we were lead to our table, we noticed that it had a hot place in the middle. My wife got excited. We sat down and were handed two massive menus. There was many different choices. I love Korean BBQ, Japanese and Asian quinine alike, and my wife is also fan and loves her sushi. This place had it all. I ordered tempura shrimp, and the BBQ Beef lunch special. It came with soup, steamed rice and 8 (yeah, I thought it was a typo... It wasn't) side dishes. My wife opted for some sushi and the teriyaki chicken.   The service was impeccable. The wait staff was h very friendly, and helpful. Our food came out in a flash, you hear me. We blinked and they were bringing it out. It was piping hot, and sizzling as they sat it down. One bite of my BBQ Beef and I got teary eyed. It had the nerve to be everything I expected with a little smoked flavor as if it was grilled over wood. It was well seasoned and AMAZING. I reached across the table and snatch some chicken. Bam! Amazing as well. Out of the 8 sides we loved the radish and cabbage kimchi, the caramelized potato, the fish cake (and I don't eat fish, and had eaten it all before asking what it was and was surprised... It was delicious)... I took pictures of what was left of our food, and sent out texts to my friends. I ordered a second order of the teriyaki chicken for lunch tomorrow, and I'm posting a review here. This is a great place for a girl's night, a date night, or an affordable lunch. We loved it and will be back soon!

asWduReHUpUws5d-kfQuhA.text: Overpriced. Not aycee and if you want to grill. You have to order two meat choices. Will run you up 50$ at least. The side dishes are ok. No steam eggs.

xII_MhH_uJYDOhWFDOI5LA.text: Was in the area coincidentally around lunch, so perfect timing to try this place out. Seated and served promptly. Banchan selection was good and tasted delicious. Ordered Jalapeno Bombs, Jjamppong (spicy seafood noodle soup) and BBQ Chicken. Loved the jjamppong and jalapeno bombs, not spicy enough but they were delish. t2vGe-jYdZWYJUSjmr8Aeg.text: (Lyrics - Foghat - Slow Ride)  Seoul bites, right in Phoenix Seoul bites, right in Phoenix Seoul bites, right in Phoenix Seoul bites, right in Phoenix  I'm in the mood The Japchae is right Move to the Galbi We can eat it all night  I was pretty skeptical of this place when I first saw it.  It was in an area close to a lot of chain restaurants so that was a downer for me.  As I arrived to the place I was somewhat put at ease.  The place was fresh and chilly as in most Korean BBQ places.  It had a beautiful bar plus the place was clean and a modern Asian theme to it.  Moreover, I rather appreciate SeoulPHX since they had a combo selection based on the size of your group.  We ordered the 5 people combo which came with onion pancakes, salad, and tofu soup.  The onion pancakes was bland and lacked textured, but the sauce that came along helped give it some pop; pungent, sweet and spicy all at once.  The tofu soup was okay at best based on the morsel of quantity I received.  I can't speak about it much since the star of the meal came right after; Galbi, Bulgogi and Spicy Pork.  The meats were all well seasoned and I barely used the oil and salt for dipping.  Our waitress would always ask us how we liked our meat temperature which is always a plus; rare indeed please!  The staff was on point that night since after every choice of meat they changed out our grill tops.  This process really helped by keeping the flavors of the type seasoning and meats separated allowing you to taste each to it's full potential.    In the end, SeoulPHX really had something going!  Service was on point, except they need to figure out how to deal with check separation for larger groups; 3 cards per party isn't going to cut it.  The marination of the cuts of meat was solid and overall ambiance was well done! - Enjoy!

LLmVGX_GFmfbgHUvSzJrCw.text: Went on a whim and can honestly say one of the best places I've ever found on Yelp. If you enjoy Korean bbq or just want something different and fun, this is the place to go. I've gone to quite a few Korean bbq restaurants and for the price, quality of food, quality of service, and overall atmosphere, Seoul BBQ and Sushi has all of them beat.   My girlfriend and I ordered the dinner for two and got the short ribs and pork belly. The short ribs were well marinated and juicy. The pork belly were great cuts and some of the best I've had. The sides are always my favorite at a Korean restaurant and the selection here was amazing. The simplicity of Korean dishes can sometimes get ruined by not allowing it to stand on itself. Seoul does not have this problem.   We have definitely found a place to go back to and it's great for small or large groups. Thank you to the staff for making it great. We were celebrating my birthday a little early and this was quite the treat!

P-jnLnKtxN9BPOuPs32Usw.text: A-OK in my book. The restaurant is pretty big and is a fun atmosphere for a friend outting or a family dinner. The side dishes are unlimited, but they ran out of many of the things we liked. The chive pancake was super oily, in fact out of the 5 people I dined with no one ate it. The pork belly samgyeosal or something like that, was super thick and fatty. Not the good, melt in your mouth kind of fat either. They have some marinated beef that was pretty good. This place is pretty mediocre, but since there isnt many other korean bbq places in phoenix it may be your only option. If this is the only place near you, then it will suffice. I would not go out of my way to come here again.

r95BHjtWWRM5EEFL30TinQ.text: This is my favorite KBBQ place in the Phoenix Metropolitan area- and that's saying a lot because I've lived here most of my life. I lived in NorCal for a few years as a university student, where I tried KBBQ for the first time and was kind of sad that I wasn't going to get the opportunity to have good Korean food again. But I was wrong! This place is a gem.  All of the meats are fresh, the side dishes are well-seasoned and consistently refilled, and the service is awesome! Many KBBQ places tend to be kind of hands off, but the servers here check on customers often, will help flip the meat, etc.   Furthermore, the portion sizes are generous. We bought the KBBQ combo for two people and had enough leftover food to feed another person. While it's kind of pricey, it's reasonably priced considering the quality of meats (and how expensive KBBQ is in general).

LKcLn57qh3XkYQw0M2IFsw.text: We did not order the Korean bbq so this review is purely on the Sushi menu at lunch time. Overall very poor experience at this restaurant.  We ordered the Sushi & Sashimi Lunch Combo. Description: Chef's choice 5pc sashimi and nigiri served with California maki. Served with Miso soup  What we got was: - California maki where the crab was basically a crab salad that was more mayo than crab - No miso soup was ever provided - Received 5 small pieces of sashimi, 3 tuna and 2 pieces of one other fish, both did not taste very fresh - 2 pieces nigiri, also not very fresh and covered in onions to mask the taste  From the description in the menu and the photo in that was in the menu it seemed like we were supposed to get 5 pieces of nigiri and 5 pieces of sashimi but that was not the case. Very disappointing for the $19.99 price tag and not worth the money.  Waiter was pleasant but ended up trying to tell us that their menu was going through an overhaul and they were fixing photos, prices etc.  Had to ask for water refills and the waiter only refilled one glass on the table even though both were empty.   We won't be coming back to this restaurant for sushi.

lmrBOWHx1WPLTU_oLCu5eA.text: Enjoyable Korean experience!! The overall experience with the venue, service, and food was exceptional.   First, Banchan was most extensive with 16 items; I don't recall receiving this many banchan, ever. It included sweet potatoes, egg plant, pickled eggs, and two types of kimchee and many others. The variety seems to vary each day, and I enjoyed eating them every time I visited here.   I have tried bibimbop, bibim nang meon and gunmandu. Bibimbop, with mushroom, spinach, bean sprouts, hit the spot. Bibim nang meon was also right on. Mandu were delicious and not too greasy although deep fried, . The skin was crunch and the stuffing was very tasty. The venue is clean, the service very western (This is a good thing). First class all around! Even bori cha came in a double insulated carafe to keep it warm.  There were a couple of misses unfortunately.  Kimchee was off; perhaps this was intentional for more Western palate. The taste was shallow and sour (closer to sour kraut), and lacked pungent kimchee-ness (you know what I mean?). Also the fish cake was stiff and skinny.   Despite a couple of misses, this was an exceptional dining experience; it deserves 5 stars. An amazing array of Banchan surely deserve 5+ stars. When it is all said and done, despite a couple of misses, I believe this place serves well the general population with "slightly westernized" Korean food without losing the core of Korean-ness. "Highly Recommend" is my rating for Korean food lovers, korean food novices and my friends.

tpG1zdCQ8kmi99lJBYPg-A.text: I have been to many Korean BBQ in Arizona and in California. So far, this location is one of the few that has high quality meats. With that being said, it is by far the most expensive BBQ. I went to this location only once so I do not have anything to say about the services other than that they were OK. They ran out of side dishes and I was really disappointed, since we paid 39.99$ for each plate of meat. The portion is small too. However, do give it a try but you have been warned about the price for its portion and quality!  If you are going with a big party of 6+, I recommend to call in and make a reservation. They do have private rooms for such party.

YzXvoa8oSEY_pzcFE-8tEw.text: This is by far the best Korean food I've ever had and the service was the best among any restaurant period. Come to find out later that our wonderful server Jonathan was the owner's son and he had such a kind, knowledgeable, masterful presence and walked us through the key dishes and all the side dishes and utensils to really invite us into the best way to enjoy the food and experience. You get so much more than your money's worth with the food, we were so full and had leftovers after tasting so many amazing flavors in the side dishes, appetizers, entrees, and the finishing note of sweetness in the rice drink they have. The restaurant itself is absolutely gorgeous and I can't wait to go back with a party to make use of one of the luxurious looking private rooms around the building.  After our amazing, above and beyond experience, we had the absolute joy of happening to run into the owner, Albert, as we were leaving. He so sincerely appreciated our input and review and I was thrilled to be able to tell him in person what an absolute success his restaurant is to have delivered immaculate food, service, experience, and pricing all in one. Instantly my new favorite restaurant and my friend and I cannot wait to be back with more company.  Keep doing what you're doing, 11/10 will recommend and dine again!

T9xYw3hm1CelrMVkmil0uA.text: Really really great service. We walked in 30 minutes before closing, and all but a few of the menu items were available to us due to them shutting down certain machines needed for some dishes. We drove a long way into town and really wanted some comfort food, which is exactly what we found here with the tofu stews and bibimbap. Our food came with an overwhelming number of sides, all of which were delicious (they may take some getting used to if you're not familiar with Asian/Korean food).   We were greeted and checked on upon by an older man and woman, who I assumed to be the family that owned the place. They were extremely friendly and welcoming and really enhanced our experience here!

The kimchi was good, the pototo side dish was impossible to eat, they were cut so big we had to bit off them like apples, and the rice bowl was pretty but the portion was really small.  The space is amazing and very large - nicely remodeled and new and very clean. Service was excellent. We ordered the gamjatang which came in this huge, impressive portion to split between four people. That was amazing. The fried squid and kalbitang were amazing too. vqF7Dg2v1brmSCfYQ_W_PA.text: AMAZING food!! Beautiful ambiance...with private rooms that are perfect for any gathering! All of that would've been enough for this 5-star review but they also had incredible service. Friendly, accommodating and everything you want in a restaurant staff!! THANK YOU!!

IKx9BWIhgi2PUq7LvE4iEA.text: Such a fun place to eat! Great food and atmosphere. Me family and I dine here often. Highly recommend

Zm5xMwpa6QF7eteRQACTyQ.text: Went with some friends and we had a great time.  We had the Korean BBQ 4 person combo.  The waitstaff cook the meat at your table on an inset gas grill.  The service overall was fantastic.  They answered our questions about menu items and we're always available to help out when needed.  Everything that came with the combo was delicious.  The amount of food that came with the 4 person combo was easily enough for 6 people.  In addition to 4 meat selections, over a dozen side dishes (banchan), and rice - there was also a seafood pancake, steamed scrambled egg dish, and soup.  It was a feast!   We will definitely be back.

cG_0JI1E9nBmeyfC9iSwhw.text: I think that this was a very good restaurant, and deserves 5 stars, because many, many times I go to Korean restaurants in L.A or San Jose, etc. I think this one served pretty good quality of Korean food hardly found in AZ, Lots of very friendly waiters and waitresses, many side dish choices, the restaurant is very big and cozy, and it is very clean. I enjoyed the fried dumplings, all the side dishes, kalbi tang, gom tang, yuk gae jang and tofu soup. Especially tofu was home made and my dad loved it. Everything was pretty quick and we got a table quickly. I enjoyed the whole meal! The restaurant was very spacey with a clean restroom, an interesting sushi bar and more things to lure my attention. Authentic Korean food and I enjoyed eating here!!! Thank you:)!

YB6INX1YDbb5AVqcrRtVcA.text: I was very excited to try this place as soon as I saw the restaurant from the I17 freeway. Finally got to try it today, on a Friday.  The restaurant was clean, service was prompt, the place nicely decorated. However, the very reason we came here was to try the barbecue on the table. I don't recall anything on the menu that mentioned anything about barbecue being available only if you order from the dinner menu. I was very disappointed that the server never bothered to ask if we wanted to do table barbecue. Maybe we were judged? Not sure. The food was ok but nothing to write home about. I could have gotten it from a to-go place just as good. We spent 35 dollars including tip for 2 lunch entrees and 1 appetizer.  No return trip to this place.

KY_uxm8aa4GrsI9R-FlPbw.text: Very good korean food. They give the most amounts of side dishes in the valley. Im not talking just about portion but variety! They gave us over 15 different kinds of side dishes! Also so much on their menu!

a0VrSQB2eVBBF0tF8WVbog.text: For a first timer, this is the place to go. But it doesn't end there, my friend from LA who brought me with him for dinner is a longtime lover of Korean BBQ, and according to him LA is the place to be for it, but even he loved it! Let's stick to my review though: the food was great, but I don't have enough experience to compare it to anything. However, I can say it was very flavorful and our server did a good job grilling it up. David (our server) was very knowledgeable, professional, and personable. He answered all of my questions and made suggestions that I could not be happier with. The ambience and environment was very enjoyable, music was at a nice volume, and the bathrooms are SICK. Prices were more than fair for the food we received, let alone the service that came with it. Will definitely be returning!

iJ0tho_UzXQY5NlEuxbVmA.text: Awesome place! We have been looking forward for this restaurant to open to have great kbbq and we were not disappointed. Great meat and awesome customer service. Definitely coming back!!

Qy_DsvZudveSQquSJITYmQ.text: This hands down my favorite Korean BBQ restaurant in town! The warm and friendly staff will sweep you of your hangry feet. Don't skip the chapchae or galbi beef!

8ERAXgCl1TfuFmlwWfJzXw.text: Loved the food and service. I would defiantly recommend this to my Korean family. Love that more Korean restaraunts are showing up in Phienix.

Kqt5Pd4M9z6dJB7tAwx8rQ.text: Don't let the outside fool you, it's a classy place inside! Full bar, many beers on tap, great ambience. Our servers explained the menu to us and were able to enunciate every dish. We did the Korean BBQ Combo A, more than enough food for 2 people. It came with soup, salad, shrimp dumplings, potato pancake, 16 Korean sides, rice, and 2 meats. They cook the meat to perfection for you at a grill in the middle of your table. We will be back to try the sushi and the rest of the menu, also when they add a Happy Hour in a few weeks!

ctiGj06yUtys1Zn9GmVV1A.text: We really liked the place. Kids are really enjoy the food and atmosphere here. Great creation of all the small dishes. The prime rib unmarinated is the best.

R2rTT1aAcHcrv_0F3-BdxA.text: My wife and i visited this place for the first time on Jan 26th.  This place is awesome in a re-modeled TGIF building.  This is an upscale Korean BBQ restaurant so expect to pay a little more than the college town pricing.   There are quite a few BBQ tables with some large private rooms for large groups as well.  This place was pretty busy when we visited and quite a few people waiting to get seated.  We ordered the combo A which was a lot of food for 2 people.  The server did all the cooking and we just enjoyed the eating.  A lot of small dishes.  The waiters and servers were all nice and very professional.  We will definitely bring people back next time.

drIdaWOgddQ3ow7loMGtjQ.text: The family took me here for my birthday. We won't be back. Easily the worst service I think I've ever had out dining. Food was mediocre at best. Really skimpy portions for the BBQ. The side dishes were all of poor quality. Food was better when it was a Friday's.... The atmosphere and the hovering owner and manager was just off. I felt bad because I think they know it's a rip off yet perhaps they aren't setting the prices..... also to our undertrained and horrible waitress, never ever ask if you need change.

Wox85CMP1jW07RjXTBCvQw.text: What a great place!! My children & I had sushi & awesome soup with fish ! Everything was so fresh!!  The owner was so wonderful!! I can't wait to go back next spring training!!  GO CUBS!! Thank you, Albert!

LX4yX_-gZbtczzHUECNZYA.text: The service was great,  I got my food quickly and the waitress was friendly. They have a button on the table to get the attention of the waitress but it's a weird gimmick that loses the authenticity of going to nice restaurant, otherwise the place look amazing.  The food is 3 1/2 stars and a bit over priced. Overall the service is where they excel above my expectations.

15efiKNWDWpZSHi4DZgK-g.text: I'm not sure if this place just opened or just reopened, but they have a pretty great lunch deal going on. $12.95 for the Bulgogi and you get rice as well as all the side dishes ... 8 of them plus free refills. Not a bad deal. The food is pretty good too ;-) The service was excellent! Didn't wait more than 5 minutes for drinks and to order. Plus there is a call system to buzz them to your table if you need them. I'm going back to try their dinners. Is this this place a try. This aren't too many Korean BBQ options in Phoenix but this one satisfies my Korean BBQ needs

Z6lhnJtl_kbJKgInFAAfKw.text: So I was visiting some family in the Phoenix area. I drove past this restaurant when i was in town for a conference, but sadly it was not open. I went to another Korean place that did not suit my taste buds.  I was very thrilled to find that this place was open this time around. Let's just say, it didn't disappoint at all! My first impression was very good. Friendly service, clean restaurant, and it's big. We had a large group so we sat in one of the private rooms. Enough about that.   The FOOD was really, really good. I don't want to say it's the best ever because that wouldn't be fair. Everyone has different tastes. Let me just say that across the board, everything that I tried was DELICIOUS. We had a variety of appetizers. The chicken wings and potstickers were gone instantly! We had some different soups and noodle dishes, some sushi and of course the BBQ. They have a wide variety of meat cuts and cooking at the table was not only fun, but obviously you control how much it's cooked. I prefer my BBQ with some pink, but my kids like it a little more well done. The exhaust fans do a nice job of minimizing the smoke when you are cooking. The Dolpan was one of my favorites. My sister had the Galbi Jim which really was phenomenal. The beef was so tender and juicy! The Tofu Kimchi Jaeyuk (which is a spicy pork dish) and the Ojing-O Bokum (spicy squid) were also table favorites. There were lots of banchan (little side dishes) which came out. Some I had never had before at other Korean places. Always fun to try new things.   The drink menu had some fun cocktails and the owner even came by and brought a couple new creations to try. They had a nice selection of Korean beverages like Soju and makkoli and of course beer and whiskey. I didn't even take a look at the wine selections. I needed to leave something new to try for next time.   I will definitely be back here the next time I'm in the Phoenix area!

mc28z4PKuASieo0TUTuuiw.text: Food was ok, management was a little odd with their statements and actions. We had the best waitress and then out of no where the manger came out to tell our party to keep it down which was odd as we were the only people in the restaurant. For a restaurant where the food isn't the best you think they would want their clients to have a great experience at least.

fUABeK5sZqDlyZBEiVDuaw.text: We are Korean Americans and this was probably one of the best Korean BBQ restaurants we've been to in AZ, WA, OR, NV and NY!! (We travel a lot). Hands down, this restaurant provides the best service I have experienced in a typical Asian restaurant.  Service was prompt and attentive.  They have awesome selection of tasty banchan.  We ordered hamulmaeuntang (spicy seafood soup) and it had the best selection of seafood.  Pork bulgolgi was very tasty.  I was little disappointed with galbi but I am very picky about my marinated meat.  We are super happy to have found this place and we will be visiting every time we are in town.

i3y9Tzi3X0_arToR8yj7ng.text: Can't say enough good about this place.  The 'unmissable' red signage is BIG & BOLD.  That is the only slight in this review, as it doesn't speak to the Korean elegance apparent as you walk up, and in!  The owners great you, and we waited just a few minutes.  The entire staff, the many servers and bussers have a very Korean like work ethic.  The food was spot on!  The tables, the bar, the rooms - Spot on!  Then there is the food. Having spent 10 days in Buson, S Korea, I can tell ya that there is nothing but perfection here!  Home made tofu in the soup, perfectly cut and marinated meats, 14 tiny bowls of tasty & authentic accompaniments circled the grill. Oh, JUST GO HERE!!!  You'll be thrilled you did.  Right next door to Pappadeauxs off I17 @ Peoria.  LOL, the big red sign...

YFwQOtGrpZiFHjprIKrOeA.text: Finally a good Korean restaurant on my side of town. It's so hard to find a good Korean restaurant in Phx. I feel like everything decent is on the east side. I'm so excited to finally have found a place where I can get my korean food fixes. It's a little on the pricey side but it's worth it in the end. The portions are good and they give you 16 refillable sides!(Banchan) I've been here 4 times  and I've ordered something different every time and haven't been disappointed. So far my favorite is the yukkejang and any of the jun are amazing. Service is always great and if you ask for barely/corn tea it's on the House. Oh and they open till late if u want to hang and have a drink!

9ULNhQfYAiAu7UYJ672wFg.text: This restaurant is amazing. The food is scrumptious and the owner and staff are extremely attentive and friendly. This is one of the best Korean BBQs I have ever had. If you are in Phoenix and want a delicious dinner with a wonderful ambiance, this is the place for you. The next time I'm in the Phoenix area, I plan on eating here.

goro5wkog_HBdp068R91oA.text: Loved loved loved the kimchi stew!  Seriously the best I've had in the valley.  The service was really good and loved the atmosphere.  Like the sides they had with the BBQ!  Just a little too expensive for me.

nAiY57A1CrU_uYW52zVuYQ.text: This restaurant was one of the first that came up after we unpacked in our hotel room and started searching for dinner places on Yelp. The close location, excellent reviews and interesting menu made it a no brainer. Unfortunately Google Maps took us around the block a couple of times. Also the name in Yelp is Seoulphx but the exterior of the building just reads Korean BBQ. Heads up if you get confused.  Once inside we were quickly seated and informed how the process works. You can cook your entree yourself at the table or have the chef do it. We opted for the later and our beef bulgogi was perfectly done. In addition you have 12-15 small side dishes along with rice as part of the meal. We loved them all even the funky little fish mixed with hot peppers. For a finish you are offered slightly fermented rice drink which was delicious. The owner even shared how they make the kimchi.  We will return!

dr4la02GWHneHjgqQwnPpQ.text: Food runner served my soup to someone else then served it to me thinking I wouldn't notice. I had a seaweed salad with sashimi. Sashimi wasn't fresh with the exception of the salmon. Soup was bland even with the sides. The sides are basically just different types of pickled cabbage/kimchi. I wish I could've gotten some rice paper with it or at least large leafs of lettuce or cabbage to mix it with my rice to enjoy. I had to ask for extra rice because the one that goes with the meal is a quarter cup serving. I also noticed that the waiters have to cook the bbq for you on your table which defeats the purpose. I'm fairly disappointed. I'm new to Phoenix and I haven't found a reasonably priced Korean/Japanese/Thai/Chinese anything. Places out here think it's ok to overprice because they're the only option in the area. Honestly nothing compares to the places in LA. The hostess was really nice and they have metal chopsticks Which is the only reason why I'm giving ANY stars. I was thinking of not posting anything because I don't like giving bad yelp reviews, but I felt like it was a responsibility to post my experience.

w2WnLZrM9eEJv91XtUeaJw.text: ATTENTION PHOENIX NATIVES: If you've not been here you must try this place out. I enjoy eating Korean food so much, I decided to drive over to the other side of town just to have some jjigae.   Best decision EVER. My experience was amazing here! I felt welcome and at home Right away. From the hostess, to the servers, and the owner, service was excellent and the food was delicious! I ordered the sundubu jjigae, and it was absolutely phenomenal! It had the perfect level of spiciness to it with great flavor! High five to the cook(s) running the kitchen- My dish was brought out with a nice rumbling bubble to it :)  The owner, Albert, was very personable and I had a great time chatting with him about Korean cuisine amongst other things. Before I left, he had me try a few flavors of soju and I gotta say I can't believe I had never tried it sooner. ALL of the flavors I sampled were very smooth and refreshing. He was also so kind to offer me a nice refreshing rice drink that helps aid in digestion. I hope to come back here one day, and if I do ever end up in Phoenix again I will be sure to make a stop!   It's a shame I can't take this restaurant back to Austin, but thank you for the wonderful experience :)

aQ7D_QX5d50X4un_R4Tz0Q.text: The service here is extremely attentive, friendly, and very welcoming. They are very generous with the side dishes, and they were all fresh and well made. Their menu selection was plentiful and even had pictures for the majority of it, which is really helpful if you're not sure and want to order by eye. I also appreciated that they had menu choices for bigger group meals, you don't see that all too often. All the appetizers and entrees were reasonably priced and aesthetically pleasing. Taste-wise, everything was well put together and clearly made with effort and care. There was literally not one thing I disliked. I am really thankful that I randomly came here, and I will definitely be back again.

c1b4R3q9StF5vAXlR5stkQ.text: Seoul BBQ & Sushi is located on the northeast corner of I17 and Peoria Ave.  They are occupying the space where TGI Friday's used to be. Looks like they did extensive renovations though as no hint of TGI Friday's remains; it's gorgeous inside and out.   They provide very extensive menu from BBQ to stews to salads to sushi. We wanted to try everything on the menu but had to settle with Gamja-tang, soon-tofu, and sashimi salad with kimchee pancake for appetizer. Our order came with table full of banchan, too many to count. It's so amazing that each of these morsels were so tasty. They could open up banchan store and I'd be coming here just for that. Everything is authentic too.   Did I mention they make their own tofu and mandoo (potsticker) from scratch? That was a bonus!   Even though we were full from the side dishes before our entrees arrived, we still managed to taste everything. The kimchee pancake is made fresh had nice bite to it. The stew was amazing. My son said it was the best in Arizona. The sashimi salad was so fresh, tasted like the chef just finished cutting up the vegetables. The sauce paired nicely with the crunchiness of lettuce and cabbage and cold/fresh sashimi. Would definitely get this again to share. The soon-tofu was good (spicy is very spicy though...get medium instead). Needless to say, we had to bring leftovers home. We packed the leftover banchan too!   The service was excellent. They were very attentive. They've been open for about 2 months and still in the process of training new employees but you wouldn't know this from the excellent service we received. They still haven't had official grand opening so I'd definitely try them out before they have lines out the door. We might be back tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sashimi salad - #42
Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soon-tofu

VY_SOflJnn6A3oeU1GpuNA.text: Took my parents here for my dad's birthday, and I am very happy that we had his birthday lunch here!   My parents really only eat Asian food, and finding legitimate asian food that isn't in a hole-in-the-wall looking place is rare. I came across this on Yelp and decided to give it a try.   They have Korean and Japanese food. We ordered the home-made dumplings, seafood pancake, Samgyetang (chicken ginseng soup), and galbi.  Everything we tried was honestly very good. Everything was presented very nicely and picture worthy, and it tasted great! The side dishes are some of the best side dishes I've had. They are presented so well, and unlimited refills on those as well. Radish soup was great!   I also like the authenticity of this place. My parents wanted hot water, and they got barley tea, which is just made from roasted barley, to help aid digestion. Apparently it's a staple to Korean meals, and I love that they gave us that instead of just plain hot water.  A lady came over as we were eating the samgyetang, and she was telling us how to eat it. It's a ginseng soup with a whole stuffed chicken in it, ain't that easy to eat that thing, so thanks for helping us out.  Our server Ed was very attentive as well, and never forgot a thing that we asked.   All in all, It is much more expensive than other Korean bbq places. But, I can also see where the extra cost is coming from, and to me it was definitely worth that something extra! It was a great dining experience from beginning to end, and I will definitely come back for a nice dinner out or another celebration!

NCbG088WMRtjd5a93q7ksQ.text: Great service and we got our food quickly. I love every dish we ordered. Will definitely be coming back!!

g41KTzcPOQAgXwPqebvWNA.text: I loved it.  The people who work here are so lovely and helpful.  The food is amazing.  I'm not an expert in Korean food but I had some flavors that I had not tasted before.  As you can see from the image of the sashimi, the fish was so fresh, cut to perfection and quite generous.  Come here for amazing food and a lovely atmosphere.

8pUBaC-aX3oIGo8bS7GshA.text: I drove out here to enjoy some Korean food that I have been craving. I lived in South Korea for two years and grew to love the cuisine. For my first order, I got the kimchi jigae. It's a hotpot like stew and it had all the flavors that i remembered. I just wish it just came with more especially considering the price. The sides that came with the meal, were all pretty good. My favorite were the kimchi and the potatoes. Overall the food was great but the portions were small.  The staff was super polite. This place had a mixture of Korean old ladies and younger staff of different ethnicities. My water never went dry with how much they paid attention. The restaurant is very clean and modern. It's honestly really nice inside.   Me and my buddy weren't expecting a military discount but we came in uniform and got one without asking.

j5Xj8i7zdcpa8qwJ_w-HPQ.text: line was too long at seafood place next door so we walked next door.  I love Korean food so was really happy.   the BBQ is not AYCE so you have to choose individual proteins and it's really far too expensive.  they get major kudos for the banchan.  I think there was 16 types.  the bimimbap was good.

UTCn5xFrHVxlxO8-H6OklA.text: They are very friendly.   They start your meal with a clear soup, with thinly sliced turnip and small bits of beef. It's a simple soup but I enjoyed it very much.   We ordered jumuleok, crispy rice sushi, shrimp tempura, japchae, and yukgaejung.  I might have spelled those incorrectly, and I've noticed they are spelled differently at different restaurants. Oh well.   The shrimp tempura is pretty standard, except it only has 3 pieces. The dipping sauce was a nice flavor, fairly standard as well.   The crispy rice was fried sushi rice topped with spicy tuna and avocado. I love the different textures/mix of flavors. You get 4 pieces.   The yukgaejung is a spicy soup with beef and I think it has sweet potato noodles in it with some wood ear mushrooms.   This place has a lot of sides so you get a lot of options with your kbbq order. The jumuleok was okay. I don't really have a whole lot to say about it. It was different than our normal kbbq place.   They don't have hot green tea. I was a tad disappointed. They had a barley tea which they said was very good but I wasn't in the mood to try a new tea.   Their servers have the ability to take your card right at your table. That's nice they don't make you wait a long time.   The restroom is very clean. I appreciate that.   All in all, we had an enjoyable meal, and had a lot of food to take home.

wyLpH0PHzXGvWsqnwc4crw.text: This place hit the spot right after we got off the plane from NYC. The service was polite and very accommodating, the food was fresh, not too salty with large portions and the site was kept clean.  What a gem in the Southwest! Some of the Korean places in the NYC area should take should take some notes.

LquOQCSi8OCVTPBVGAs3Fw.text: We visited Seoul BBQ for the first time last night with four adults and two children; we all left stuffed to the brim and deliriously happy.  As one previous poster stated, the menu seems expensive, but you definitely get your money's worth!  We ended up getting the kids an order of fried rice to share while the adults went for one of the combos.  The combo we chose said it would feed about 4 people and it came with all of the little sides that Korean BBQ comes with plus an vegetable pancake appetizer,  a salad I had not seen in my previous Korean food experiences, and a soup.  Salad? AH-MAZING!  Vegetable pancake: DELISH.  The sides and the sauces and the servers and the meat? NO WORDS.  Even the kids tried some of the meat options--there were four--and enjoyed them.  My oldest son was practically drinking the red, soy sauce-based sauce.  The adults were stuffed by the end of the second meat!  That combo was over $100 and it could have easily fed all six of us.  As much as we go out to eat, I think this is the first time we've all left in such a state of euphoria, completely satisfied by the food, the experience, and the servers.  Several servers worked our table and each one was kind, patient, and happy to explain anything we asked.  My only negative point is I'm sad we waited this long to try this place!  Can't wait to return!

ZQ7-1YJRqoSY8ZpWuWeb-g.text: Stopped on our way to Flagstaff.   Super friendly and amazing food. Make sure you bring a serious appetite!  They also have a wonderful selection of adult beverages!

ri3HctF2zgsilau7aMIhlA.text: The service was SO GOOD ! everybody were so nice and helpful. The food was amazing and fresh . Will definitely come back :)

T6dtkvvuLyp3b-E6MOG9kw.text: This use to be T.G.I.F's, a block away from my work. We were looking forward to a place other than Pappadeaux. This place was clean and  quite for a late lunch. Food was yummy, however out server was terrible. About a 20 year old girl with rings in herr face and bad makeup and attitude. If you wanna charge a premium price for food it should be served by at least a competent server. I spoke with some of my co-workers about our experience when we got back to the office and basically the same problem, mostly young inexperienced servers who do a poor job. Now some people did say they had more mature servers and the experience was awesome, unfortunately that was not ours.

EmXPVTsMGVnK4PT5Fd30BA.text: A must try, ate lunch here today it was awesome. Ordered from the dinner menu and they brought 16 side dishes, that's right 16 and would refill any you wanted   The main course was incredible, beef short ribs with vegetables, so tender.  The co-owner came by and recommended a seafood stew for my friend, they must have emptied the ocean for this dish. Not cheap but a great value, treat yourself this place is a new treasure.

kJpYBuL7MrjdPU1YmwEzbQ.text: Still in a soft opening and service was great.  We sat on the patio and shared the fried rice and some sushi.  We enjoyed it all!  The inside is clean and beautiful.   Sushi is priced right.  Korean dishes are pricey but I think they always are.  I would return for sure and sit inside for the whole cooking at your table experience.

-_3UGPKIZXKW9FucgGT1aA.text: The Place To Go For Korean BBQ and Sushi.  PERIOD. Fabulous food and extensive menu.  Staff is knowledgeable, accommodating, and quite fun!  Small Party room for larger tables is perfect. Am bringing large group of out of town guests next week and they are in for a treat!  Not just dining, but a food experience.  Can't wait to go back. But save your appetite...food is plentiful!

tCfzFyeUASJ3DkrkX0CcvA.text: The food is good, but nowhere near worth it when it comes to the price for the Korean BBQ. Sushi is good and worth the money, but the BBQ is extremely overpriced. $30 for $3 worth of frozen meat is ridiculous. With a party of 5, it took 20 minutes between the first entree and the last entree to hit the table, with the last entree being frozen beef that they call bulgogi. The short ribs cost  $35 where you would pay $15-20 for better quality and more meat at any of the other Korean BBQ joints in town. The service is also REALLY bad. The server was a nice guy, but he definitely needs more training. Also, random staff members would just walk up and start putting meat on out table grill. It was extremely rude and unprofessional. There needs to be a change in service very quickly or this place will not last. The best part of the meal was the mandu and that they have Hite. Other than that, only come here for sushi or the appetizers and the beer. DO NOT waste your money in the BBQ. If you want Korean BBQ of the same quality, go to Koryo at 43rd ave and Peoria and save 50%. We paid $80 for a $40 meal. More than likely will not be coming back.

gyAq31upz5KBMsTmKHGUkw.text: We went in as a group of 10 with a reservation. The service was excellent! They greeted us & the manager/owner was even there to help us make choices & introduce us to her staff & the restaurant in general. They put us in a private room that was a little on the small side, but was comfortable. The previous room could only fit 8 comfortably. We asked for a recommendation & were shown some package meal options. I think we got the $99 one and it was perfect. We had several choices of meat to try (which she helped us choose as well. Keep in mind that this isn't our first Korean experience. We've tried Yakiniku in Hawaii, and 2 of the other "authentic" well-known Korean restaurants here in AZ. But since this place was new to us AND they had MUCH more food choices than we were used to in a Korean restaurant in general, we thought it would be more efficient to ask for suggestions.) The meal came with soup (I think you can choose from 2 different ones, though there are more on the menu if you buy seperately) salad, and I *think 2 appetizers. We order shrimp siomai (though I'm not sure if that's what its called on the menu) and some kind of "pancake". It was all delicious & the kids enjoyed everything as well.  Everyone had their own lidded bowl of rice, and I think you can ask for more. Not sure if its free or not.  The salad was a good amount, but we would have preferred more soup. They brought out only two small/medium sized bowls that we had to share amongst ourselves. We asked for one to be spicy and one not to be spicy. (Spicy definitely tasted FAR superior, though the non wasn't bad. Just obviously not as flavorful.) The banchan was amazing! They gave us SO many, and some I've never had at any of the other Korean restaurants! You can ask for more or less & pick which ones you'd prefer as well. They have a system where you can press a button on the wall if you need them. And the lady in charge welcomed us to call on them as often as we needed. They had 2 servers there cooking the meat & serving us whenever someone needed more food. Once all the meat was cooked, they left us to enjoy the food & company, but made sure to remind us to push the button for anything. The service was excellent, and the food was just as good if not better! We arrived on a Saturday and were the first people there, so maybe that had something to do with it. By the time we left our private room, we noticed that there were many families & couples eating too. For those who care, the restrooms were immaculate and the entire atmosphere was just very enjoyable. Its much more upscale than your favorite hole-in-the-wall Korean place, but I can tell you that its just as good. Sometimes you get quality but they skimp on the quantity ( and vice versa)....but not here! Everything & everyone was ON POINT! If you've got a large crowd and they love Korean soup, I suggest ordering extra if you're buying one of the package deals. But other than that....totally worth the drive and money. (We were coming from Avondale & Goodyear.) My brother & sister in law were actually visiting from Japan and are used to good Yakiniku, and were extremely pleased with this restaurant! We ALL were! Thank you for the wonderful lunch Seoul! I'm praying someone buys me a gift certificate for my birthday & Christmas cause this is definitely my new favorite restaurant.

OxDrLu91Oy1-N_EKmtBDGw.text: As someone who suffers severe fish allergy I am not usually able to eat asian food that isn't religiously vegan. My husband said the food was excellent and begged me to try it or at least talk to them and see if they could be safe.  I did and the owner and the manager came and spoke to me.  The owner told me one of his children is allergic to seafood and peanuts and that he is very aware and careful with cross contamination.  The kitchen is separated so despite a terrifyingly fish heavy menu I was able to order a starter and a noodle dish that were excellent and I'm happy to report, not cross contaminated.  I am sad that all of the bonchan was not able to be guaranteed safe so I did not get to enjoy all of the awesome little snacks but it looked really good.  My non allergic table mates said it was good.  Because each table has a vent hood  neighboring tables' cooking doesn't affect other diners.  The restaurant is beautiful and the service is good and despite a menu loaded with every kind of thing that could kill me or ruin a good 4-5 months of my life, their kitchen practices are sound.  My only issue is that I wish the bonchan was kept on the fish free side so I could have enjoyed it too.  Overall will definitely be back!

tn5i91iuyYVFuwVDvkI3eA.text: Yelped korean food and found this place and it got good reviews so had to try out!   A great variety of panchan! And their service was spot on. We were immediately asked if we needed to order drinks first and we were so dang thirsty from our airplane ride!   Homemade friend dumplings- super! Plumped filled and cooked to perfection. I had to add a little soy sauce to the dipping sauce because it was a little sweet for my taste.  Spicy fried chicken wings- my hubbies favorite to eat anywhere! Thumbs up !  Kalbi tang- great broth! And our waitress even brought us some ponzu dipping sauce when asked because that's what we're used to back in la/Orange County.  Menow meyun  tang (spelling in English is pretty bad so spicy fish soup) - loads of seafood and fish. Very full and flavorful!   Bathroom squeaky clean and the inside is very large and modern interior.  So glad we went! Took a hour because of traffic but worth the wait.

S8jl64e1-hb79y5tszMURg.text: Searched this place in yelp , we wanted to try .Called last night at 9:00pm , a woman answer the phone! I asked her if we coming in 10min can we still dine in , she seems had some attitude asked me "what do you want ? You know they kitchen close pretty soon " I told her We are going to have BBQ, and she put me on hold , not sure if she hang up on me or the phone cut off .  I did not call back , we choose oh ya in Scottsdale . I just wanted to say , the hour they listed on yelp or google that they close at 10pm so it was just 9oclock and I told the women we can be there in 10min , why is such a problem that we can't dine in ?  It's ok though , I may still try this place next time !

y0kdzIT4uxQ0EumciP9Oeg.text: Great place. Staff is wonderful. David was perfectly friendly! Definitely a date night place as slightly more spendy than I'm used to but worth it!

NOp1cnUffBvi6NNwyO6XvA.text: I had their prime rib and marinated prime rib and it was so good. There was so many side dishes and all of them were flavorful and delicious. The meat was also so good it melted in my mouth. The server was also very nice and attentive to my family and I's needs as well. Also, they had korean shaved ice so we tried the strawberry and regular shaved ice. It tasted like the shaved ice from sulbing, a korean shaved ice cafe! I could come just for the shaved ice  I will definitely be coming back for more food with my friends!!

lxVXzwFd7ZojZte0M6gScg.text: Korean bbq but also have options for Sushi and traditional korean food. Very friendly and comfortable place to relax. Excellent Bibimbap. Soup is very good. Spicy wings. Many sides come with meals. Fast service I recommend this place. I will come back for the bbq.

lwR-R-K8pWiW8Dky_ZUeUQ.text: My family and I had our Christmas Eve dinner tonight at Seoul Phoenix. As always it was great!  The pan fried dumpling are handmade and amazing. There was 8 of us in a private room and it was fun with the bbq and variety of meats along with the array of tasting side dishes.  By far our favorite Korean restaurant in Phoenix!  A must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Nd5diGOo2gJk3KXDycriJw.text: A friend and I wanted to experience some KBBQ without absolutely stuffing ourselves with AYCE. Seoulphx was a great way to satisfy that craving. Our waitress was attentive and very knowledgeable.   I know this has been beaten to death, but the banchan was both extensive and extremely edible, and refilled after any request. (I'm a sucker for fish cake).  The meat itself was also very succulent. The brisket was industry standard, it's not my favorite dish, but the bulgogi was loaded with flavor and not overloaded with fat.

dTggAmixjR7A8CoVz727rQ.text: My husband and I went here two nights ago. The service was great, the server tried to be as accommodating but there's no food available for kids. It's pricey and we didn't even get the Korean BBQ. It was worth trying, though. A lot of different options came out but we were so stuffed by the time our meals came out. Food tastes decent. We got the fried rice and the beef and pork dumpling soup.

4IaAosJPY8oMc8vtRbSfoA.text: Finally had a chance to try this place and it was all that and then some. Great ambience and every server was really pleasant and knowledgeable. There was so much food and all of it was great. Not the cheapest Korean BBQ but worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GVAivDGxCU1Oit67hnS9Tw.text: If you're looking for authentic Korean BBQ, this is one of the best places in the Phoenix area. I've been here a dozen times and the food and service is consistently quite exceptional. I've always been super impressed with their spread of traditional Korean side dishes and their meat for BBQ is great quality. All of their dishes are very authentic. This place will not disappoint.

mUjByKeaY_KFIx6aZn-Fag.text: So much fun and SO much food. We had some sashimi and the crispy rice sushi to start.  Very good, very fresh and nice portions. My husband and son shared a BBQ combo of short ribs and bulgogi. They loved it! Came with all the little bowls of goodness, shumi, soup, rice, a veggie pancake and some veggies and salad. Literally too much food. I got a bibim bop, with a squeeze bottle of gochuchang on the side. So good! I haven't been this full since 2010! The service was exceptional. I tried a soju and it was pleasant but i don't have to have that again. They brought a little Korean dessert drink with the bill that tasted like iced apple pie. It was good but too full to enjoy. I can't wait to go back and pace myself a little better next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Is there enough food on this table!?

ySOtgAGu_4zrEoW8Axll4g.text: This place was awesome. My wife and I ordered their Bibimbap and it reminded me of being back in Korea. I had also ordered there Kimchee fried rice, which I have never tried before. It was a delicious alternative to regular fried rice. My daughter ordered their regular chicken fried rice and she loved it. She actually finished it all which she does not do too often. Everyone enjoyed what they had. We are definitely returning customers!

A6kUjlGCScfmunNm2ilN0A.text: UPDATE: It has been a week and no one has made the effort to contact or reach out to me. I contacted the restaurant through their website as well (through email) and still, no response. They did, however, pull $80 out of my checking account (there was no shame in accepting the tip I left the waitress). I will settle my humiliation with this update and leave it at that.   This review is for the 3rd time I came to SeoulPHX. The first time I chose the 2nd choice for $99.99, I believe. The second and third time I came to this establishment, I chose the 1st choice for $69.99. The first two visits were phenomenal. This is why I came the third time around. (Prices reflecting how much we paid to eat here)   The reason I am giving this restaurant one star is based off of my last and final visit. I ordered samgyupsal and galbi (choice order #1) the waitress who brought the meat and all our sides to us pulled a LONG piece of hair OUT of the samgyupsal. I looked up at her shocked and she said, "I'm so sorry. No one in the back has long black hair except me so this just happened right now." She then proceeded to take out all the meat surrounding the long black hair and gave the samgyupsal a stir on the grill. She pulled ANOTHER long black hair out (W T F) and said, "oh no.... I'm sorry sorry.... uhhhhh...." She gave me a long look in the face (which meant she wanted forgiveness) and I said, "can you replace it?" SHE SAID "NO I COULD NOT!" She just took more meat OUT around the hair and that was it. My husband just said, "don't worry they'll bring out more meat for us and probably discount us for the hair. No need to make a scene." We are NOT confrontational people. Please understand our position as I suffer from depression and anxiety and he is introverted. Of course in our minds we could do anything, but out loud, it is difficult to stand up and demand proper treatment we deserve.   At the end of our meal, NO! She did not replace the meat and when I asked for the discount because of the hair incident, you know what the waitress said? "No. I can't do that. But I can give you 10% military discount."   Well. My husband said, "let it go. I will talk to the manager." Well, low and behold there was no manager in the store who could assist us.   Moral of the story. Stand up for yourself and demand they change your meat when the waitress pulls out not one but TWO long strands of hair from your samgyupsal right in front of you. Also, don't let your anxiety and fear of confrontation (even if you are in the right) keep you from NOT tipping the waitress (YES. I tipped her. I am not a prick)   I want to call the health inspector because I feel like the waitress and this business thinks of my family and I as indecent because we didn't do ENOUGH to stop the waitress from serving us samgyupsal mixed human hair for lunch.   Shirley (name we were given as the manager) please give me a call. Thank you.  I know they could have easily just plated the meat differently and served us the same human haired mixed samgyupsal but at least I would have been satisfied with the effort to make us think we were being served with dignity. Today, they did not show any effort to correct the issue.

cESLc5xPeYj1__tm-TNW2w.text: This place is clean, immaculate. Food is big portions, you would need to share. Get the wings & share. Get the macaroon dessert out of this world, Very expensive food. Not for kids

2l2JfTOZGobEuqfm64KeGw.text: The finest Korean dining in Phoenix area. It is located in odd place if you miss entrance from the one way road you need to go all the way around to get in. So if you use navigation, needs to pay attention.  Surprised to see well decorated large size Korean restaurant in Phoenix. Made me feel like Chosun galbi in LA. I went there for lunch had hotpot bibimbob. It was great. Their fried dumplings has thin fluffy and crunchy texture which is different from I have seen and the best fried dumpling ever. Side dishes are good.

mQIJHwdSgFNglh1AKlvcww.text: What a NICE surprise!  We didn't know what to expect and it was such an eating pleasure!  I'll use my husbands words "now THAT was a dining experience!"  All very attentive, extensive menu,  nice music and atmosphere.  Food was very good, HUGE quantities, 16 small side dishes brought out for sharing!  If you like trying new tastes and experiences this place is for you!  While we were there....every family who came in was Asian and you know what they say....if the native people are attending...it HAS to be good!  Highly recommend!!

AbE8ztQkpw7B1w-h-nnhXw.text: This was amazing!  I grew up with the ultimate seafood noodle soup that I thought would always have the title, but Seoul BBQ & Sushi's handmade noodles and seafood soup was amazing!  The pan fried rice plate was delicious!  You have not lived unless you eat at this place.

nI2xh2kIBJ4JuleEPpPQAw.text: The food was great. First time here and I was absolutely blown away. My wife has never had Korean bbq before and wanted to try it. Our server was amazing, he took the time to educate us and make great suggestions for food to try. My ratings for this place? Food 10/10, service 10/10, atmosphere 10/10, location 7/10 overall I would eat here any day and will return.

61i0CoQDNzdEyeFA8nPhcA.text: Don't try to get take out at the last minute or order over the phone too loud and the woman hung up on me. Terrible service

6cMln8zIW48utFceMQrZng.text: Went here today with my wife for lunch and was very happy we did. Everything was delicious. We were so happy with the food we were eating and planning our next trip here. We got the ribeye beef bbq and a soup of tofu with vegatables (could choose from beef, seafood, veg or combo). Meal came with rice, a beef broth soup with asian radish, and 7 small side dishes of different cold items. Everything we tried was good. They even offered to refill the side dishes but we had plenty of food. Paid $25 before tip for lunch which was more than we normally would, but for the quantity and quality of everything we had, it felt like a fair price. Can't wait to go back and try more.

p9S27Cm-d4Q2g6g3_rscBg.text: Good place, lots of choices, Jonathan, our server was very nice. Just would like to hear back from management that this place doesn't use MSG. Can you please confirm? I will be back.

KEce7ufjhqavqdRVKghXZg.text: SO GOOD!!! We had the spicy soft tofu stew and it was perfect. My friend had veggies with it and I chose seafood. She also had peach soju and that was refreshing!!   The ambiance is so nice, it's cute but casual. The staff were so nice. We went on a weekday around 2pm-3pm and there was no wait.   Definitely recommend going here.

kVvv2gyc-CIM027y_p0eHg.text: I lost 52 lb on keto diet, this place has most of the stuff I can eat and stay in ketosis, delicious too.

DmRY7CbrWzyT0yBxAhRb0g.text: Authentic and high quality meat. Despite of some reviews, I think the prices are fair since they serve big portion of meat. The meat combo comes with 10+ sides, salad, pancake, fried shumai, and soondubu.  Sushi, on the other hand, was ok, nothing special. It's hard to judge the fish quality in the desert. Service is excellent.  Recommend!

IJBxSYBYAuhuZbhE2kg2MA.text: Some people wear their heart on their sleeves.  I wear mandu on mine... literally!  It's raining mandu!  Hallelujah!   I've been hearing great things about Seoulphx and for the most part, the food was excellent.  They have a great lunch menu and the place is clean.  I enjoyed the flavorful LA Galbi, the pre-meal soup was hot and tasty, and the sikhye at the end of the meal was cold and refreshing.  They offer a huge array of banchan as well.  So why the two-stars?  The service was pretty great [Ale was sweet, the waiter was friendly, the Asian chick was cool] except for one waitress.  Just one waitress ruined my lunch for me --- one waitress dropping a plate of dumplings on me, that is.    I get that accidents happen.  I'm certainly no graceful ballerina but my goodness, the way she handled the situation really irked me.  She gave me some paper towels and a cup of club soda which was nice and she even replaced the items the sauce got splashed on.  The thing that annoyed me was what she said at the end of the meal when we were about to pay. "Oh yeah! Would you like some vanilla mochi for me pouring mandu on you? I completely forgot!" How can you forget when I have a huge slash of sauce across my chest and my jeans are now stained from mandu sauce?  The way she said it was off-putting.  She was very aloof about the whole situation.  I have no idea what her name is but she's the blonde chick with the tattoos on her forearm with a yellow manicure.  So we paid for our meal, even the dish that I'm currently wearing on shirt and jeans, without so much as an apology.  I'm not mad about the accident.  It happens.  But the handling of the situation was poor and she was very dismissive about the incidient and for that, I'm giving this place two-stars.  This was at 1PM in the day and now I'm going to have Seoulphx stains on me, smelling of pork & beef mandu for the rest of the day, and not even so much as management came by to apologize.  Bummer.

Living in Arizona we didn't expect to find anything as good as the real thing, but this restaurant really hit the spot!  We were super impressed with the selection of banchan and the samgyupsal, and kalbi were perfectly authentic. Service was excellent - they event have the bell to call for service just like Korea. Will definitely be coming back!

Z90ivu-ZdSBbYp0eZSINcg.text: This is a great restaurant to go to if you're looking for quality Korean food it has a number of options to choose from along with great customer service. The experience was enjoyable, my family and I had a great time trying be food that we've never had before. We felt very comfortable and will definitely be returning.

aJnpZpj-sIJO5FCkDzC5Bg.text: What a great find! I was looking for a place to get soup and this place came up. I love Korean food and it's not too far. The restaurant is huge with a front area bar and sushi bar. They also have private dinning rooms for big and small groups. The service was good, very attentive. I ordered my favorite dishes: grilled mackerel and jjamppong. Come here hungry because their side dishes will fill you up, which is more than the norm. They also give you a complimentary desert drink that tastes like horchata. I can't wait to go back and get tofu soup and hot pot. If you go here for dinner, it's best to RSVP.

c6o7onPRjBlBk-mTFp_yQQ.text: Came here with a few friends the other night and we really enjoyed ourselves. The staff was crazy friendly and super on top of everything. We asked for our food to be cooked in the back as we had a 1 year old with us and we didn't want any burners on. Everything came out perfectly cooked and warm. There were so many sides our table was almost over flowing. I would say its a little pricey but you get what you pay for and man was the meat good and they did not skimp on anything. My favorite was the Galbi: Marinated short-rib (Boneless) They had sooo much flavor and there was plenty of meat. I highly recommend starting off with the GUN-MANDU (6pcs) Home made Deep Fried Dumpling they were perfectly fried. They also have tons of of things here besides Korean BBQ. Sushi, Soups, Cold and Hot noodle dishes, and giant macaroons. I think next time I'll come for lunch and try a Bento Box.

mgqiZsxsqLgR5_isF1xN7g.text: This is the type of restaurant that makes Phoenix a better city. The food is outstanding, they have a nice drink menu, and the layout is very well thought-out. Most significantly though, is that they have presented the Korean culture in its best light to an audience that may not have much exposure to it.  If you walk around on a Saturday evening, this restaurant, which is somewhat off the beaten path, is packed. Moreover, the majority of the diners are not Korean. I love that this place has the ability to bring in this much traffic and that they are able to present a very well-executed Korean culinary experience. They aren't watering it down or fusing it with the Western palate, and yet they are able to make it attractive enough for people to go out of their way to come out. It makes Phoenix the kind of city that has an outstanding Korean restaurant, not because it's in Koreatown or because there's a ton of Koreans next to it, we have it simply because Phoenicians like eating there. Finally, you can see the work ethic of their team when you realize they're open every single day of the year.  For completeness, the things I like about the food is having a ton of side dishes (usually 16), the vegetable pancake, and the bibimbap. Their japchae, bulgogi, and kalbi were all fine, to my palate just as good as the stuff I had when I visited S. Korea, but I'm not that discriminating on those dishes. Wife likes having sashimi as an option. Service was lightning fast and friendly.

00h3J6CWrxz3QkpIFRydPw.text: Love love this place!!!!  Amazing side dishes. They all tasted goood. On the pricey side but I guess it's expected.   It's so hard to find good quality Korean food around here but you can't go wrong at Seoul bbq. Nice friendly service and entertaining owner when he's there.   Definitely try the jjam bong (spicy seafood noodle). They are not stingy with their seafood.

k02r1lHBhErpuWd1bWAYXA.text: Im Korean and Scottish. And it has been a very very long time since I have had good Korean food let alone KBBQ. Its something that isnt easily found here in Arizona.   Until now! We took my boyfriends younger brother here for a belated birthday present. We order 3 different types of meat. It was one of their preset meals. Im sorry I cant remember which one it was.   Anyway, we ordered the chicken, LA galbi, and bulgolgi. It came with two appetizers and our choice of soup! And of course the pleathora of banchan.  The service at first was kinda iffy. The girls hair got into our food when she turned her head to check on the grill. I guess i feel like all of the long hair on anyones head should be pulled back. Especially if theyre handling our food.   She was new though so its understandable. Another gentlemen stepped in and took over most of the time. He had glasses and was very attentive to serving us.   Over all the food was amazing. And well worth the price tag. We each also got a dessert. My boyfriend ordered two types of Mochi. And myself and his brother ordered the shaved ice.   This will be a frequent stop for us for sure.
