hGzhtAZxJ2DJ8oh_79q4Qg.text: I have been in search of a quality Korean bbq place near me and my search has now ended after discovering this gem!! All I can say is WOW! This is by far the best place I've tried. Everything about the meal from the many many delicious side dishes to the perfectly marinated and tender bulgogi and short ribs was amazing! Prices are very reasonable for the quality and amount of food you get. And on top of a perfect meal, the service was unbeatable. You can tell the staff really work as a team and help each other out to make sure each table has the best experience possible. I will absolutely be recommending this place to all my friends and family and I can't wait to return!   After my most recent visit I felt the need to update my review. I am just blown away by this place! The food is always outstanding and completely satisfying to any craving you may have for Korean bbq! Visited today during lunch to find they have many good deals on lunch specials so prices were extremely reasonable for the quality and amount of food you get. Ordered the beef bulgogi which never disappoints! However this review is even more based on the staff. The customer service is outstanding and I love that there is such a family feel to it. Came here with my 2 year old (which we all know is not always easy when they're in their terrible 2's lol) he started to get a bit fussy but not once did I feel out of place or like they were annoyed with us which is honestly such a relief when your child starts to throw a fit in the middle of lunch. The table busser at the time along with one of the waitresses were extremely friendly! The waitress in particular who wasn't even our server at the time (and I wish I got her name because she was so awesome. She had braided hair and a gold nose ring) was absolutely amazing!! She stopped by our table to chat with my son, and after asking if it was okay he had some ice cream she took him to the back freezer, let him pick out what ice cream he liked and then presented him with a yummy plate of ice cream whip cream and chocolate syrup! My son was so happy and mom and dad were even happier getting to finish our meal in peace with him finally calming down lol. She wasn't even our waitress but simple stopped by our table out of kindness and I'm so appreciative for that! Kindness like hers along with the rest of the staff here should not go unnoticed! 5 stars over and over again!!! Thank you Seoul for always providing the upmost quality and service and always making my family feel so welcome here!! We are customers for life!!!

9X81PqDr7rnllv0M6KMZiA.text: This is EVERYTHING that comes with Combo A (see pic) and it was delicious, adventurous and so much fun! Our server helped cook the meat at our table and did a great job at explaining what to do with all the food and sides. Well, you eat it, but if you're new to Korean BBQ, it can feel intimidating.  My last point is to not avoid this place because you aren't familiar with Korean cuisine. They have a broad menu of familiar dishes, but if you are feeling like you want to try a more authentic Korean experience, this is the place. The servers will walk you through and help with everything. You will NOT regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Combo A - So fun!

UT_ULts2zLSgZS12NJ1jaw.text: This place just opened up and I have been eager to try it. The access is good from the freeway.  The restaurant is clean shinny and spacious with lots of tables. We went there for lunch. They have a lunch menu Monday through Friday.   We ordered Mandu and Haemul Pageon for appetizers.  There were 5 large pieces of fried Mandu well cooked well stuffed with delicious goodness. The pieces came out hot and not oily.  The Pageon covered the entire plate and was full of seafood. The edges were crusty and flavorful with wonderful texture. The insides were steaming and cooked just right, not doughy.    Yukyejjang came out in a nice thick bowel. The broth was hot with a delicious blend of spices and saltiness.  The meat and vegetables provided great texture and complement of flavors.   The Naengmyeon on the other hand is a cold dish.  The color was clear with hint of amber but to taste it was icy cold, refreshing and just a little bite from the mustard I added. The fresh made noodles were thin and had the appropriate wonderfully firm texture.  I drank in the broth then went to town on the noodles with the accompanying seasoned radish and cucumbers.   The Jjamppong came out with that steaming rich dark pepper red broth.  On the tongue it had a rich complement to heat, sweetness and smoke with flavors of the ocean.  The dish was filled with crabs, muscles, clams and shrimps in the shell. Delicious.   The Soon-tofu seafood style was also quite pleasing.   Just writing this is making me hungry for more.   So far this is the best Korean restaurant I have encountered in Arizona.   The service was excellent and the bathroom was very clean and modern.

I had the Yukae jang which was awesome.  I had some of my dad's kalbi (lunch special) which was pretty good.   I can't wait to go back for some bbq and bingsu!

xTno2dTiJej0WuQDRCaL4Q.text: Finally, a truly authentic Korean BBQ experience in metro PHX on par with establishments in much larger markets. Chap-chae is awesome, along with all of the glorious marinated meats for grilling.  The sushi and sashimi is hands-down the freshest I've found in The Valley. They carry Kurosawa sake which is a favorite of mine.  Easily one of my favorite places in town I look forward to each and every visit.

LbSfByHbBprH6SERsl3S2w.text: Our families first time eating at a Korean BBQ restaurant. This place did not disappoint. The food was delicious the wait staff was great. We ordered the BBQ combo D, the meats were tender and plenty of other food included like appetizer, side dishes don't remember what else but we had plenty of leftovers to bring home. RVkDpi6SkjRDdHzHitLrSQ.text: The restaurant is very nice very clean.. the waiters was very friendly and loved the atmosphere I give them 5/5 the food is okay I give them a 3/5  Their food is overly priced  Good for date night definitely won't bring the "whole" family here again. Too pricy

jryYBxJZbOMkClFhfnGJGQ.text: I'm pretty new to Korean food, I tried the bibimbap and it was so tasty!!! the staff was very friendly and attentive, after my meal they gave me a cup of sikhye, It was the first time I ever tried it, it was delicious, I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting delicious food. Im definitely going back there to try other foods.

IMbwv_uZHYyIsHecmoJLQQ.text: Ate here shortly after they opened and as so impressed had to take friends there last week. As good as any Korean bar b q I have eaten...including my trips to Seoul.  The owners have hired an outstanding chef. The decor is imported from Korea. They have the individual rooms for small groups. They have a full bar (including soju). I am not a sushi eater but my friends are and they were highly impressed.

6MblR6E5P6HQ3OVM-IcFfg.text: Foodie checking in .. all the way from NorCal. Had to stop in and visit one of the few Korean restaurants in Phoenix Arizona. Restaurant is roomy and clean and the waiters/waitresses very nice. Now to the food.. ordered three dishes .. Kalbi, soon-tofu and the grilled mackerel .. we opted to grill our own meat at the table. As the other Yelpers have noted a good variety of bonchan (side dishes). The Kalbi comes out boneless (wish they left the bone on) and the cut is quite thick. I would have preferred the more traditional thinner cut with rib on. The marinade was tasty-more on the sweeter side. The soon tofu soup was quite good. We asked for medium spicy but I would say it was on the milder side. If you like medium spicy ask for spicy.. the bonchan although a good selection was noticeably sweet. Overall, the experience was good. There's a bell for each table that is used to call your server. Foodie checking out...

ouIEnrSRoi6ownO1IMDlUw.text: I was on my way to Sedona and passed this on the highway and I knew it was exactly where I was stopping on my way back to the airport and so I did.  I'm Korean and I have Korean food everyday.  That being said, the food and banchan were superb.  I ordered the yook-gae-jang and my dinner date had the seafood soon-doo-boo.  Both were larger portions than most restaurants and so I was OK with the higher prices.  Service, location, parking, food, and decor were all superb!  I, hopefully, will be back on my next trip there.

1fHHmMWt0rHdkgYimh-Jmw.text: The place was amazing! One of the better choices for Korean BBQ in the valley! Great service and delicious food!

JNspbTVZJtVS812M4A2F6g.text: We went here as a family with all the grandchildren! What a fun place. The decor was great and the food was excellent. The service was exceptional too!! I had a sashimi salad.. Which was excellent!!! Also sweet and sour pork belly. Very yummy too!!! We will definitely be back!!!

la-bjnKgc8OGV5Ju9rv1WQ.text: I am a huge fan of Korean cuisine and have been craving an authentic restaurant that rivaled my favorite East Coast eateries for some time now. Well my prayers have been answered!! THANKS Seoul BBQ & Sushi (Seoulphx)!! The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming, the service was wonderful, the portions were substantial and the signature drinks were delicious (the bartender even allowed one of my party to sample Saki for the their first time). I have definitely found a new Phoenix favorite.

yKnWC6-jMu_b4YDMg3ZuKQ.text: First time here with family from out of town and the meals started to arrive way before our drinks. We were all dying of thirst and pressed our call button as we were sitting in one of the booths. Server came in and got our drink orders again. Still our drinks came 15 minutes later. We pressed our call button and they shut it off on their end. We pressed it again and then they came in with our drinks. This wasn't even the worst of it. My sister in law was feeding herself and her daughter. My sister in law felt something in her mouth after having a spoonful of rice. It was a pretty decent size metal in her rice. We definitely rang our call button to our server. He displayed his sincere apology and went to talk to the manager. Their compensation was to give us all free dessert on the house. After displaying her loss of appetite after the encounter and that it there would've been a possibility in her daughter eating that metal, they offered a different food type (dessert). We never got to actually speak to a manager which shows the professionalism of the restaurant. They offered us a 10 dollar gift card to use on a return trip. We started we were out of town and that we were not going to be back here. I managed to have them use it on our current transaction and they did. Overall, service for food wasn't bad but being that restaurant only had 6 tables filled, that was horrible service to get just drink orders. Management did nothing to help ease my sister in laws mind after that encounter with the metal in the food. 10 dollars doesn't suffice. We were definitely not asking for a free meal and not even 50 percent off of the meal. We were definitely disappointed in management not even speaking to us personally and helping to resolve the issue. Having a piece of metal in food should not be resolved with free dessert. We would've just been satisfied with 10-20% off at most or not paying for the rice dish we found the metal in. I definitely will not come by here if we ever come back into town.

5eezdfck21bAzttGMz4VDA.text: SOLID!!!!   I cant wait to go back.  Super friendly staff and great food.  Great spot for a big group too!

5Wnsqz29h1YgNqdwcmNI0Q.text: Came across this place from a recommendation by a friend. The restaurant is brand new and immaculate. Hostess was very friendly and waitstaff were excellent and checked on us several times during the meal. The food was possibly the best Korean food I've ever had, no exaggeration. Had the kalbi jim (short rib soup) and the hwe dap bap (like a poke bowl) and both were exceptional. Definitely plan to return.

EUaRJ4w6CiwITBZKzVSTjw.text: The best Korean food I've had in AZ! Friendly service, and they serve alot of the side dishes. Pot of barley tea and the sweet ginger drink at the end are nice, not many Korean restaurants in the area bring those things out anymore.

8kL_O145FWqZCph3uXqfpA.text: Absolutely outstanding!!!  My partner and I are visiting town and wanted Korean BBQ.  We tried this place and it was wonderful!!!!   The food was delicious and the staff and service was over the top friendly.  We also discovered a Korean drink called Soju.  It's a must try.   Ask them to sample a few flavors...wow!!!     We'd highly recommend coming here!!!!

wMMuIW5YctGqVNzyXLRDUQ.text: Good authentic traditional korean dishes with ample parking. We came for lunch and their portions were pretty small. Ordered bbq kalbi and for $13.99 for lunch we got four small pieces of meat.( not the whole strip of LA kalbi but four pieces) thats like dinner pricing and the portioning were way too small. p0xDJvII9JOfXRIVw-Tlwg.text: We found this place on a whim, and it was probably the best whim decision restaurant we've ever been to! First of all the place is lovely inside. Very nice space with private rooms for larger parties. The service was fast & very friendly. The food, drinks, & dessert were all delicious. We will definitely be coming back & spreading the word about this much needed restaurant in Phoenix!

iG0U9iu_HLrwQOKsXPyklw.text: Absolutely wonderful service and food! Great clean and modern space with very friendly staff. You get so much food here. Very high quality as well.

jM_VnI_7LxrRtIo0e53ygg.text: Always looking for new Korean restaurants to try, not very many in Phoenix.  I was pleasantly surprised, the food was fresh and seasoned very well. Restaurant was very clean and lots of room for big parties.  A bit pricey which is typical for any Korean Restaurant but one of the better options available in Phoenix.  We will continue to go.

W4uY1SUHw4zdGayBTQMGFA.text: Truly disappointed in this place. We love our Korean BBQ and have been searching for a decent one near us since moving to the valley. Perhaps we were spoiled with all our options in Southern California or while living in South Korea, but this place was just bad, from service to pricing. We are highly unlikely to ever come to this location again. Hopefully they figure it out soon so that they don't lose more potential customers.

7bnmDslk5UNT34bElMDbgg.text: Great authentic Korean food. I spent a lot of time I Seoul back in the day and I love Korean bbq.

ThEAMdIfRe0RMlCBfRd_AA.text: Good Food lots of selection from Korean to Japanese food. Everything looks good. Friendly staff , very attentive, checking all the time in what you need in your table and on top of that there is a bell to seek help when  you need one  Awesome experience

dd0IOPHU1lFyndT0QWpAxA.text: This was my first time trying Korean Bar B Q.  The food was wonderful.  The only reason I am giving them 4 and not 5 stars is it was quite pricey. However the staff was extremely friendly, the food was very fresh, and we had a very good time overall.  My family has had Korean Bar B Q many times over so it was great to experience it with people that knew what they were doing.  But the staff were also very good about explaining as well.

GSG2x0-_yxk5pPmTWyu24g.text: Excellent food and excellent customer service! The whole staff, not just your server, makes sure you are taken care of. All the food and sides are fresh, and the sushi is top notch!

xjhlQLZblMtBTxBLLU3JvQ.text: The service and Atmosphere is great.  But the food doesn't taste good.  Don't think we will go back ...,

cuCqYQMi5EKKx0NwcU6bjQ.text: Went for a business lunch and it was simply excellent. I've been to many Korean BBQ places and like others mention this is a little more upscale than most, excellent service, it's new and clean. Food was great. I had salted makeral which is a rare delight, perfectly cooked bulgogi style short ribs, and of course their assortment of small dishes that come with the meal. Those were a real treat - anyone who likes "tapas" would definitely like this place. My companion is a chinese gentleman had seafood soup that was served hot, steaming, and he took one spoonful then started nodding his head in instant approval. I will return with the family for a special night out.

39yxGS6wIH67kiopJLIE-A.text: General info: NOT an ayce kbbq place. Serves Kbbq but also serves regular korean dishes ie you do NOT have to do kbbq. Kbbq is charged individually per plate of meat. I did not do their Kbbq but each meat plate is ~$15-25. Super expensive IMO. Might as well go to an ayce Kbbq and pay $20-25 to get ayce and different types of meat.   I've only been here once and will probably never return. I only ordered one thing: Yukgaejang. It's the worse yukgaejang that I've had and I've ordered it at all of other Korean restaurants in Glendale, AZ.  Broth: super bland (and I'm a very bland eater!) Very little ingredients were given for the soup.  Place is nice, spacious and clean. Staff, however, were a bit odd. One of the lady (probably one of the owner) came over to us as we were eating and instructed us on how to eat our food. She told us to put the rice into our soup and also that the broth is "very good" so make sure to drink all of it. I don't mind if she thought we didn't know how to eat korean food and was trying to help us but she continued to stand there watching us even after she nodded and smile at her. No! I do NOT want to dump the rice into the bowl of soup! She finally left after I guess she realized we were not going to follow her instructions. However, that is not it. As we continued to eat our food, two staff members (I don't remember if one of it was the same lady that gave us instructions) were standing behind a counter wiping dishes or doing something but they were talking to each other and staring at us. It was VERY OBVIOUS they were talking about us. Obviously idk what they were discussing but it was very rude.

n6no7ehKdY6R99rK7pS5kA.text: I've been back to this restaurant 3 times since 1st trying it. I'm pleased to say I have a new favorite location for Korean food in Phoenix!  The menu and service is very good. I try to order something new with each visit to gain appreciation for all the menu variety. I'm pleased with all that I've tried... I will be back and recommend you give it a try soon!

vqeGZj6Uzim3WLzKYLCN1w.text: We ate lunch here yesterday. They have a great lunch menu. The young man that waited on us was phenomenal! The food quality is amazing!

kCFOhy1kEnUUrvXc8echnA.text: I'm an international student who came from south Korea. And i always had a craving for real Korean food here until i found this restaurant last week!! My first visit was about a week ago and I visited this same restaurant 3 times already!! I tried different menus every time and was so surprised by the fact that everything i tried was soooo good!! If you want to try a real authentic Korean food, this place should be the first place to visit for sure!! I'm so excited that we have this restaurant in our area. This is something that you won't normally get even in Korea. And it reminds me of my childhood memory with my grandma who always made a great food. Also, the servers were amazing too. They have a bell system and you can push the button whenever you need anything but i barely used them since the servers always knew the need in advance and came to us. All of them were nice and kind, and best of all, they got customer's need right away that i didn't really have to explain much about what i want. Overall, i think even 5 stars are not enough for this restaurant and highly recommend this place for both Koreans(Try it and feel how authentic it is. You can't compare any others in U.S.) and people from other cultures.(Servers are real nice people and they are always willing to explain what the food is and how to eat. If you're interested in Korean food, this would be the perfect place to start) Oh and i usually visit as a small group with my friends but i saw they also have several, pretty big private rooms maybe for meetings or birthday parties i guess? So if you're looking for a place for a big party, this should be one of your considerations.

RnaXRckrCpSl3AkK634Y6w.text: I went here for the first time and I love it. The restaurant is very clean and well decorated. Our server was very kind and helpful. We ordered Korean BBQ combo B and it was fantastic. The meats have great flavor and seasoned well. The side dishes were so good. I would definitely come back again and recommend this place to everyone.

gCbx5tkvM7lAID_8SXoosA.text: Terrible.  We sat down as soon as we got there which meant that it wasn't busy. We sat for 15 to 20 minutes. No one came to even offer us drinks in that time frame. You ring a bell for service and we did just that,  as well as another table across from us. They got help, we didn't.  Rang again and still nothing. We both were so excited to have a Korean BBQ near us, granted it's not AYCE like we are use to in socal. Never again.  We will drive to Tempe for our Korean BBQ. Teach your staff to acknowledge your customers,  even a "we will be right with you" is sufficient enough.

BAyl-tsBuGD2Ja-FqHzoFQ.text: This is the most wonderful place for Korean bbq.  I have been several times.  It's so good.  We are always treated well and served well.  Love all of the sides, especially the spicy kimchi.  We dream about it all week long and can't keep away.

FXbcuKEBn1yiKRtN93_C2w.text: I have tried Seoul BBQ 4 times now. Each time I think maybe they will be worth the price... And each time I've been disappointed. They have a bulgogi stew that is suppose to have beef bulgogi meat, vegetables and a clear noodle made of sweet potatoes. Both times I have ordered it the noodles have been missing and there is hardly any broth or veggies. So I feel like I'm just eating meat with a little extra liquid. We usually order take out as I have 2 toddlers and another on the way... They have messed up the order almost every single time. One time I was missing the vinegar and mustard for my mul naeng meun dish... Another time I was missing the sauce for my gun Mandu, and another time I was missing the side of rice that should have come with the bulgogi stew. Twice they had to call and confirm what I ordered as they got confused. Needless to say... For the price I'd expect much more than what I have received.

jhABfnLtTSGjfAXlYSjO4w.text: Excellent lunch! Banchan galore, my favorite was the marinated spicy raw crab. The crispy fried chicken wings were nice and crispy and seasoned perfectly. The seafood soonsubu jigae was spot on, slightly bigger than at other Korean restaurants. The jjampong was packed with a wide array of seafood, mussels, clams, shrimp, squid, octopus, crab and plenty of noodles, super tasty. The kalbi was expertly marinated and cooked nice and tender. The ojingeo bokkeum (spicy stir fried squid) was so delicious, you'll want extra rice. The wait staff was very friendly and attentive and brought whatever refill banchan we requested. The decor is very modern with Korean touches sprinkled throughout. Best of luck to this restaurant, it's a welcome addition to this part of town. Wil definitely come back when craving authentic Korean food.

NfIjHG5cPSwlmbES8gdLOQ.text: This is one of the best Korean restaurants I have been to in Phoenix. We have struggled to find good Korean food, especially in a more central location. Banchan was outstanding and plentiful, ingredients were fresh and service was excellent.  We ordered jampong and bibimbap with seafood so it was clear that they used fresh ingredients. We will be back soon and are excited about the prospect of having quality Korean food close by.

VvGMmeUZwaCSLeBOPJwz8Q.text: We came here to celebrate my bday and my hubby booked a private room. There was no extra charge to book the private room and it was perfect for the 8 of us. The service was outstanding and the food far exceeded expectations. Make sure you try their Galbi- it was premium quality and the most tender short rib I've ever tasted!!! The number of side dishes were around 14 and they also served us tea and soup in the beginning of the meal and ended the meal with a sweet drink. Definitely a must try! I believe it's the best in the valley!  What also is great are the prices!!! They charged us 18% gratuity for our large party but even with the tip, we paid around $200 for our whole group! Whattt??!! Usually at Korean restaurants, we usually spend $70-80 for just me and my hubby. Prices and quality of food can't be beat!!! You won't be disappointed.

pusTdO7RWU6jWEQPkiFt9A.text: Amazing spicy galbi jjim and naengmyeon. Must have dishes for anyone looking for an authentic meal. Service rocks too.

JXqwHYtRXNxkxZET70cqTg.text: First time eating Korean BBQ and I rolled myself out of there so happy to know that this place is a ten minute drive away. The portions are huge, so go with a group and try a few things. Boba was also on point.

5ftAqa0VsTiWKVXdxg9tDQ.text: Kimchi Pankcakes for the money . One or the only spots in the valley I have found kimchi pancakes. And their sushi is on point too.

D-xvdMpD3QblHOltE5FIkw.text: This was my first time ever eating Korean bbq.  The entire experience was perfect. The patience of the staff, the quality of the food, the ambiance etc... truly made this meal completely enjoyable. Our waiter David was funny. All of the staff was helpful in showing me how to eat noodles with chopsticks and explained what each bowl was. Pictures tell more than words. I hope some day Ai will figure out how to add smell-o-vision.

c7vupEDfNgC4nIX16Cwgzw.text: I've been to many sushi places in the Phoenix, Scottsdale and Tempe areas, however this sushi restaurant had the best customer service of them all. Our server immediately greeted us and brought us waters, and answered all the questions we had, whilst offering recommendations. Though I'd say this establishment was a bit more pricey than the others, I didn't mind paying more because the quality of the food and spot-on service made my visit beyond exceptional. Our group ordered several sushi rolls and I cannot say I have a single complaint. The sushi was fresh, rich and the rice used was perfectly firm, but soft! Our sushi was also served with a tray of samples of appetizers such as pumpkin, seaweed salad and other savory options. I will be visiting here more frequently!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Well presented sushi rolls
Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Y_pieLR-8QFGdaBmiNsznQ.text: I've driven by many times, and I've meant to stop. Really, I did. Then I'd go to Papadeaux for a nice overpriced lunch.  Boy am I glad I stopped! First, go hungry, the portions are huge. I had a bulgogi beef bento box ($12.99) and with the kimchi and pickles and the other little tasty items they bring before you even get your food, I literally couldn't eat it all. I brought home a large portion of beef and rice for my son.  The food was cooked perfectly, and very tasty! Service was spot on and super friendly!  This is a great place, l'll be back!

VXy8FSdJhs6T7yDQACMo8w.text: This place might not have the best taste. But it has highest number of varieties! They even have hairtail! I ate them back to China when I was a kid! Their cooking style of Gamja Tang is different than others. Places I went before they cook it spicy. That's fine, it's a traditional hot dish for people get hangover problems. Those small dishes taste just fine. The kimchi is not that good. If you wanna know good kimchi, try the brand of Chonga, I personally recommend that. The staff are pretty friendly enough and take good care of you as long as they never bother me too much.  Well, for the taste I might have them 4 stars but 5 stars for the variety. To be fair! Fanciest Korean restaurant in Phoenix.

nrNnF4UZF5Gh_ouDGhL_mA.text: I really enjoy the food at Soul BBQ and Suchi because the food is so amazing!  The service is very friendly and they really care about you being comfortable and please with their services.  I enjoy enjoyed every single bite of their food!  This is my first time at Soul BBQ and Suchi; I only can tell the service I received was five stars.  I really wish I could have Soul BBQ and Suchi in Albuquerque. You guys in Phoenix are so lucky!

Hr_c3ezvqKeWZRSV1BE5XA.text: Super friendly staff which is why I gave it 3 opposed to less.   Being korean, perhaps my expectations are a bit higher but the food was just average. Way overpriced compared to other korean restaurants. I mean almost 30% (estimate). Would not return unless I don't want to drive to Mesa/chandler.

tUL6fD2IbdvlXsKU_bjilA.text: Food was good and fresh. Very expensive however.  The service was ok as well, and the wait staff kept coming by and flipping over our meats, which I thought was weird, because at Korean BBQ, you usually BBQ yourself...this is the whole fun of going out.  We may try it again when we are in the area.  We did really enjoy the kimchi pancake!

edYCXtjQv_V_YsZGEzkTfQ.text: Really good Korean BBQ and excellent service.  My family and I go at least once a month for dinner.  Their lunches are also delish and reasonably priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious and refreshing drink they give you at the end of your meal!

d85qulB6rSSnoYXgqsQDNA.text: This was our first time in this restaurant and although we have driven by numerous times I would discount this place as a second rate place. Well, last night we took a chance and brought 16 family members who enjoy Korean food as much as I do. The food, staff, service and ambience were found to be second to none. Excellent, excellent, excellent. The value is quite consistent with what you would expect from a top notch restaurant. Thank you to our server David whom look after all our requests. I would strongly recommend to anyone looking for the best Korean food in the Phoenix area.

WETFiHzweCAEc78O2Equjg.text: I really enjoyed Seoul. My boyfriend is Korean so needless to say we've had tons and his travel to Korea. This was my first time here (I've been back a few times since leaving this review) I enjoyed everything and the side dishes are fun and all fresh.

g3ryb5zKR79KkiJ2VlE5cQ.text: My wife and I were looking for an excellent Korean restaurant that had not already converted to the "all you can eat format". So many of the Korean restaurants in the Phoenix area have already converted.   We are very happy to say that this restaurant met all of our expectations. Excellent service, wonderful food, and absolutely no "all you can eat".   In case you were wondering, why am I going off on the all you can eat format? The short answer is "the food quality sucks because they have to meet a certain price".   This restaurant is not the cheapest, but the food is absolutely first rate. We were met at the door with a smile, escorted to our table, and the waitress became our chef (we chose not to cook it ourselves).  If you are looking for a great Korean restaurant, look no further. This is the place!!

FDtdCuyzWOMN74sOIVd26g.text: The food & service here is amazing!   We ordered 2 different beers, but they had ran out. The owner was so accommodating, he personally came to our table to apologize and offered us a beer on the house. The hostess & servers were so great with our baby and talking with us in a personal way. They really made us feel at home!   Plus the food tastes great & huge portions! We ordered a combo for 4, but it was more than enough to feed 5!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We got the combo for 4 &amp; it was more than enough to feed 5. Delicious!

gCH5taSkdlExAQ_iGqxr5Q.text: My wife is Korean so we both laughed out loud when we saw the name of this place on our way to Sedona for the day. When we got back we were hungry for Korean food so we decided to see what was good on Yelp, and this place popped up as one of the better Korean food places in Phoenix.  While the restaurant name, Chinese furniture in the entrance, the inclusion of shumai on the menu, and lack of any Korean speaking people when we arrived had us nervous, the service was great and the food was good.   While it was more expensive than I think it should be in a town like Phoenix, if you are craving Korean food it will get the job done.   My favorite was the spicy squid.  The banchan was good and the kimchi didn't suck, so I'd definitely go back.

Q5okPuEUhHXXBPe53O58tQ.text: So fantastic!  The food was great but the service was awesome!!  Very friendly and fast, but not in a rush to turn the table fast!  Just quick to get what you need and not pile the table up with appetizers and main course at the same time

UUDbl-WAHgkQ9_pSHzlkFw.text: My daughter and I thought this place looked interesting so we gave it a try. We ordered sushi, a poke salad and katsu chicken. The meal comes with a course of samples that were fun and tasty to try. The sushi was good as was the katsu chicken. The poke wasn't exactly how I thought it would be and was mixed in with a lettuce and mayo combination that was a little like coleslaw (the only description I can think of) that tastes ok but not what I was looking for. They had no issue with taking it back and not charging us for it. We grabbed a few of the ice cream macaroons to go which we fabulous! We will def be back to try some of the other menu items.

X7IJHg4kWthMSBZpbcSDpg.text: Wife and I went with 2 kids (11 & 13) and ordered the Combo A and the Korean Chicken Wings to appease the kids. We opted for the kimchi soup and Bulgogi to be our second meat.   We loved the impressive assortment of banchan (side dishes) that came with the meal and left the restaurant too stuffed to even think about dessert. Although we've had Korean BBQ several times over the years it was then first time for our boys. I'm glad we were able to give them such a "legit" first impression. Who knows, maybe they'll even try some of the spicy banchan next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Assorted side dishes (14 in all) that accompanied our meal.

1Cuz8iCBskmaEfK9YYWNHg.text: IMO, overpriced and unimpressive. To be fair, I'm comparing their effort to the food I've eaten over four years living in Seoul. Still, in Phoenix, there are at least three better Korean restaurants I can list off the top of my head.

UNK6VI-rpGCu7-3in9feMA.text: We absolutely loved this place. The owners are wonderful! The food was delicious. Every staff member is so attentive. This is by far the best Korean BBQ we've found in PHX.

S_Sv0YO10iVZ3XqNZCOovA.text: The service was great, but the food was very pricy for what it was and not the best IMO, but I'm not used to this kind of cuisine. While I was there a Korean Airline flight crew came in - straight from the airport and still in uniform, so I guess the food authentic!

ssHWL_B4H2_13YpPMTlgJQ.text: Been here twice and both times the service was good and friendly. The place is new, big and very very clean. Definitely the best Korean BBQ place in AZ in terms of decorations and atmosphere. Others look a little dirty and cramped.  The service both times has been great. We had an issue with how fatty the meat was but the servers and the chef did their best to make sure we were satisfied. They asked us multiple times how we were doing so A+ for service. Plenty of good side dishes too. It is a bit pricey although the portions were good. The sushi and other dishes aside from the Korean BBQ were delicious too. So give this place a try! They're new but definitely worth the trip.

YoMl7CTWYWUyK1-VaQVNig.text: Best korean bbq restaurant throughout the valley. "Quality food. Fresh vegis. HUGE portion. Best Overall Cleanliness." If any other korean bbq business dissatisfied you being in the valley of the sun. This is the place where you'd wanna visit. Yes they may become expensive. (But only if you don't know how to order korean food). Actually they can be cheaper and offer better quality then any other all you can eat korean bbq in the valley. Heck they were as good as thirsty cow by the diamond bar(near buena park).

jkLKYkoRSSfQZW_FwrzGnw.text: Excellent Korean BBQ food! Great location, nice atmosphere inside, not crowded at all, and there's even a "bell" to ring for service at each table. All the people who work there were hustling and doing a great job at serving us and making sure we got everything we needed. Really really impressed and we've been coming back 6 times so far and you bet we will be back every time we want Korean BBQ! Thank you!!!!!!!!

Gj2DomPxuD5QKmKGULS8nw.text: What a wonderful surprise.  My guy has been talking about Korean food for years.  He lived there for a year while in the Air Force years ago.  I ran across this place in yelp.  We had two of our friends and had a great Sunday afternoon.  He said this brought back so many memories of his time there.   I loved all the little bowl of different side dishes.  Grab a few friends and come check out the experience with some amazing food.

bDU3_kOkLhG-BifgfUFTYQ.text: I love this place. Order 43 jjampong and 69 Yuk Gae Jang. Judge the place by the service....the amazing food...the taste...not everything is about price.

EeqySCWdpBN1ok_Pv21oFA.text: Ohmygoodness! Such amazingly good food! Honestly, I was getting pretty sad about the Korean food options in the west valley, but this new restaurant is a breathe of fresh air!  First of all, it's clean. And I know what you're thinking, it's new so what? But it's beautiful inside too! The owners put a lot of thought into this place. It looks like it should be in New York or something. Cute accent pieces are placed around the room. You just walk in and say "wow what a great place!" Now the food... what can I say?? Everything we got was SO GOOD! They brought out so many side dishes too!! Normally I have to ask for more cuz places only bring out 5, but look how many there were in my photo! All of the main dishes were delicious too.   !!!! The service is impeccable too! Such nice people. They really care about what they're doing. And if you see Min (I think she's the manager), ask her about the food and what they prepare fresh each day. It's amazing!

vSee4j4MglHXb2v9MltawA.text: Lunch today w/ sister, love the place, clean, pleasent atmosphere, Waite staff knowledgeable. I've had Korean before, first time here, full luncheon crowd, business & locals; Joyce ordered spicy pork,w/8 sides, for me it was BBQ beef, & 8 sides. Sides are sm. Taster dishes and do order their bread & dipping sauces. We will go for dinner nxt. And it won't be too long, it might be the first time BUT not the last! Go on, give SEOUL a try, ypull be happy you did (:!!

ga7gwviUoeMp03oSI_q7Ng.text: Excellent sushi and authentic Korean BBQ.  The choices are almost overwhelming.  The food is cooked to perfection in front of you.  Sushi is fresh, bright and colorful.  The number of sides that come with the meal had to be over a dozen.  The restaurant is brand new, very clean, well lit and upscale.  The wait staff is excellent and very attentive.  Prices were good for the amount of food you get.

JHfqQ9A9DZy_XbrSBww0QA.text: Best Korean BBQ in the Phoenix area! Delicious meats and generous portions. Friendly wait staff and beautiful decor.

mx_mD9Xe7N6ZVJ8z91HneQ.text: great place and great service was definitelt impressed. The meat was fresh marinated and a tons of food I was super full but happy full

qaW_LfnjFtNuYfVPVxXr6A.text: As I travel often to Phoenix, I often ask the local staff to go Asian dining. This time, it was Seoul BBQ and Sushi. Apparently, therestaurant recently opened for business and the local staff seem to like the venue. There were 5 of us.  Upon entering, I noticed immediately the scale of operation akin to that of what we usually see in L.A., or SFO. The decor and ambience gets 5 stars. Upon seating, we were promptly asked if we wanted any beverages. Throughout the dining process, the servers(multiple, not just the one assigned to our table) came frequently and asked if there were any other items we wished. Service gets 5 stars.  The side dishes(or condiments) however, while many(16 of them), definitely resembling that of authentic Korean food in terms of appearance, presentation, and aroma, the tastes on all of their side dishes fall on the bland side.  As for the traditional BBQ dishes, they tasted good; not excellent. What would have made excellent would have been consistency. Uniquely and oddly, their #20 and #21, both ribs, one with marination and one without some were very tender and some were not within a same dish. I find that odd, how could beef in one dish differ in terms of texture and character. The food therefore gets 3 stars. I averaged out and gave the restaurant 4 stars overall.  I WOULD go back just to find out whether or not a meat in one given dish would taste and feel the same.

MZCgBEtq0KSiP2UVWv8piA.text: This place has the worst service I have ever had. Sushi was unexceptional. Food was small portions and unsatisfying. Way overpriced! I can't believe I gave them money for their crap food and crap service. I will never be back. DON'T GIVE THIS PLACE YOUR MONEY!!!!!

fIB94dIAjKH66MvnngluwA.text: Great place! Beautiful cuts of meat! Outstanding and hardworking service. We will definitely be back again.. and again!  Only negatives (and I'm being picky) we like our Kimchi more spicy and less fermented (fresher) and the chopped salad was soggy like the lettuce hadn't been dried much after washing it and it had no dressing on it. Just a small drizzle in one spot. Please fix this as I love sangchu geotjeori!  Also looking forward to the serving staff learning the Korean menu (how to pronounce and what it is) and being able to make recommendations from their knowledge to people that aren't familiar with Korean food. But no worries as this place has barely just opened!  So very happy to have this place in Phoenix!! Can't wait to go back!   Also - you can cook your food OR they can cook it for you!   I'll post pictures next time we go!

QxXfnKgtYq6lsnaqTPueHg.text: Hands down the best Korean restaurant in Phoenix! We have been here many times and the service and food are consistently outstanding!

T5MP67KpOsn23RDdwuSGbg.text: My mom owned a Korean restaurant growing up and I hadn't high expectations for this genre of food. Had bibimbop, galbitang, etc and the side dishes were amazing! Thank you for a great experience visiting Arizona.

jxIQNI9fLzJpzDXmBLQXYA.text: We got bulgogi and galbi tang, it wasn't what I was expecting, it was ok, but what i can't believe it was the price of galbi jim!!! One hot pot for $30??? Not even the best place of Korean food in LA has that price. It is very expensive for not getting the taste of korea :/, the topoki was good though.

fl8pkfQnAhBYyxySk_xzog.text: Oh my -you must try - it's a great experience ! Delicious & tantalizing if you like bbq & small sides. Don't eat too fast before the Finalee -best bbq pork ! ! Soup is Delishhhh !!  Make sure to pace yourself ...you can always come back !!

J1vJ3YrlpjIXplDoplrl-A.text: I can't begin to explain my love for this place! Everything about Seoul is incredible; from the staff to the food! My boyfriend and I have made this our date night go to! The gyoza, the many side dishes, the pork belly and the chadolbaki are my absolute favorite things! Plus the sushi! Actually I love it all! If you're considering this place, don't! You'll fall in love and I don't want to share it with you!   Treat these people nicely, order many drinks and make sure you tip! They deserve it! They're incredible!

hrWaMd0eaDjuJn23YGPuKA.text: First time here and getting adventurous. Thought I would get a sushi plate but ended up with something else. Servers were helpful since neither of us have been to this restaurant and newbies on Korean BBQ.   The menu is very large and you could spend 20 minutes reading it. Good news is that you don't have to cook your lunch, they cook it for you in the kitchen. Lot of Korean and Japanese items on the menu.   Started off with a couple of appetizers including the recommended Goon Mandu which are beef and pork dumplings. We also ordered a shrimp appetizer that was chopped shrimp in a breaded coating.   I ordered a Dwaeja Bulgogi Bento Box which had a dumpling, egg roll, marinated thinly sliced pork shoulder, miso soup, salad, rice and a California roll. Other dining guest had the tuna poke salad that was large enough for two.  Service was good, you need to remember to ring a doorbell near your table otherwise you may not get your service. Some of the menu items looked expensive however the plates probably serve 3 people.   Lunch specials were reasonable and more than adequate sized portions. High points were the dumplings, the marinated pork shoulder was spicy and perfectly cooked, the cabbage salad had a very good dressing. Overall a very good dining experience.

4GRyNAg9BEZWqAb2MT9xIg.text: We came here last night for a late meal.  This place was busy.  We had the beef rib soup and some sashimi.  Both we good.  My favorite part was the side dishes.  She gave us 16 different items and they were really good!  I really enjoyed my beef rib soup.   Hopefully we will be back soon to try their bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef rib soup

6nzxMb1UFG0XrxDAk_RELg.text: When I first glanced at the menu, I thought that the food was quite expensive. Although when we got our food, I realized why! The serving was soooo huge and the bibimbap that's $18 can probably feed 2-3 people. The seaweed salad was A LOT too. Usually other restaurants have veggies of some sort under the seaweed salad and cheat it that way. Oh and their side dishes!!! Literally you can get full off of it (and you can get re-fills too of your favorite ones). For their KBBQ, I think it's too expensive and might as well go to an AYCE.   Aside from that, their employees are VERY - OVERLY friendly. I'm not complaining though. Lol.   Anyways, A+++ rating all around and I will definitely be back with my family in the future!

Af2_Pw3EIHNLNTxen2i9Uw.text: After a hot day of putt putt in 100 weather the staff were very attentive.  We came as a group of 9 and had no troubles getting food. The appetizers, too many to name, were so good. The one sauce for the Korean wings reminded people at our table of a Bloody Mary/Bloody Caesar. The meat was cooked in front of us to perfection.  They even changed grill tops for one of our guests who has a beef allergy.  We had 9 people and had ordered the food for 5 people and we had left overs. The food was delicious with many great Korean flavors. The kimchi soup was a favorite of mine.  Will definitely come back when I visit Phoenix again.

hYmc_IhNDzYKiinBvLjMGA.text: First thing, Jonathan. He was the most amazing server we have had this whole trip here in Arizona. He was quick with refills, bringing requested items and being sure to change our grill plates at a very reasonable time. He even managed to handle our big family and their craziness. We greatly appreciate him going above and beyond for us. It made this experience and our late lunch here more worth it.  Now for the food... the marinated meat we ordered were just perfectly flavored and just the quality and taste of the meat felt way better than what we are used to at our home town. We devoured the multiple side plates and were very satisfied with them (specially the variety).  We will for sure come back and request Jonathan if he is still here.

E7iCd3XHtrzOuZd98bgScQ.text: A little on the expensive side, and the food isn't that impressive compared to other Korean BBQ restaurants around the valley.  One thing I must commend them for is the great service. Staff is highly attentive. Also, it is very clean and the decor is very classy.

tnGPJfomIF0FB2qIgFkVSA.text: My love of Korean food started with some of my Korean clients taking me to Korea Town in LA over 40 years ago. It's been tough finding quality Korean ever since, BUT I keep trying.  Good reviews on Yelp prompted us to drive out of our way from the hotel to give them a try. The good: service was outstanding, attentive, helpful and friendly; the menu was laid out with pictures and explanations that made it easy for first timers to comprehend (although we are not first timers); can cook meat yourself or they will do it; kimchee was varied, fresh and tasty; the chop chae. THE BAD: Korean BBQ is all about the meat! The meat was well seasoned and tasty, but barely edible given the amount of fat and gristle. How can you hit home runs in most other except the the reason for being there.  Quality control of the selected cuts of meat and even looking at it raw in the marinade as it was brought to our cooking table is unbelievable.   More shocking was the owner was working the dining room which is always nice to see, but he should be payingvattentionbtontgevmeat he's buying and how they cut it.

_2MHhtN0e6qgl3o--DnLOg.text: Had lunch here recently and the food was exceptional. I had spicy bbq chicken thigh came with soup and little samplers, it was delicious!  This place is huge, there are lots of tables with the bbq burner on the table. It's perfect for big group gathering.  The location itself a bit odd because it's facing the I-17/Black Canyon Highway which is one way and next to the corporate office & Pappadeaux Seafood, so if you miss the turn you have to drive all the way around to get back to the restaurant. I missed the turn and I ended up parking nextdoor at the Pappadeaux Seafood.  Anyhow the waitress was nice, food was good so we were happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy bbq chicken with little samplers, yum!

Y7mYr4CGJZ85h4QQVFrF-Q.text: We had a birthday party there. There were 20 people in our party and we had several separate checks.  The wait staff was friendly and very helpful with suggestions.  The food was so good!!!!  We will definitely be back.

N5_z4SHFTfIa_RHm3Nj1Vw.text: Nice place and tasty food experience..lot many items on plate so make sure you take one more person to finish it off your plates...the whole barbeque experience was great with chicken roasted in front of u on grill and I have posted more pics for your reference ..we liked the place and would go back for the chicken alone ...rest of the items were ok..perhaps as it's my first time I did not like to that extent but I will go back and try some more options at this place .

hmm8OqSCiknwGKvDKysuyg.text: The fact that I'm not going to take down a star because this place isn't AYCE means I must have really liked this place. And the thing is, I sure did!! Besides the pricey kbbq plates (and again, not being AYCE) everything I ordered were so delicious! I started with some edamame which was a really good size for 2 people and some gyozas (I forgot what they were called here lol). The gyozas were so good and very filling. I ordered LA Galbi, that was very tasty. And they had so much side dishes! I also tried their Lagoon Punch and Melona Soju Cocktail and man they were awesome! What tops this off is how friendly and attentive the WHOLE staff were. They were so lovely! Herman was a great server and Eunhee tended to us very well! They were the best! Their excellent service lived through me the rest of the day and I was just in a great mood!

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lagoon Punch with lychee as garnish

_B2Spr7oSAF1Bcr9HEwWjg.text: Wow!  Attended a friend's birthday party in the private room and was very impressed with the friendly and efficient service of our large group (so accommodating!) but the food was where this place really shines!  We enjoyed a few sushi rolls and then absolutely devoured the bimbap with seafood.  Absolutely incredible!!  Very fresh vegetables, yummy mixture of crispy rice, all in a huge serving--easily enough for two people!    We met the owner on our way out and he was incredibly charming and educated us on the lovely Korean "vodka" soju.  A truly delightful restaurant experience all around!

ibmC8BBc-aZ52hJwgEojnw.text: Wow. So I made the mistake of coming here on my own, and I needed friends to eat all this delicious food! Frankly, I'm disappointed in myself that it took me this long to get here. First, location is very clean and spacious. Service was prompt; Jonathan (mentioned in other reviews) is a rock star and also an NPR nerd, which I appreciate as a long time public radio and television professional. :-) Really, the whole service team was fantastic. I ordered galbi jumulleok (#21), which came with an overabundance of banchan. My favorite was the pickled daikon and the pancake. So many choices, though! My grilled meat was tender, lightly marinated and totally devoid of the tough parts which sometimes mar the chew. They were very quick to change out the grill plates and make sure food didn't burn. There's a small beer and wine list, and many Japanese items that I may check out next time. I will be back. With a group.

fW3_Zo1SZF-KQWKXHeoNMg.text: I love this restaurant. It's a little more upscale than it appears from the outside. The food is SOOO good and the interesting Korean side dishes are made in house daily and are unique but extremely delicious. The owner is a great guy! He came here from New York (explains the exterior look) to start this restaurant. He was behind the bar when we sat on a busy Saturday night. He chatted with us, explained the food and business in such a personable way. It really made me like him and his restaurant. You've gotta try it if you haven't!

xbb99sLANgO5hFnJFYIXRg.text: Ok this is last and final updated review: Came back yesterday and everything was perfect! I am so happy!!! I ordered the soondae as an appetizer. And had the Mandu (dumpling soup) and my mom had the bibimbap. We shared everything and it was perfection!! Maybe when I gave them my review (which I kept below) they were having an off day, I highly recommend!!   This is my updated review. I initially gave them 4-5 stars!! The very first time I ever came w my mom and my two sisters a month ago was amazing!!!! I raved and told everyone I kno that this is legit the best Korean restaurant in town!!! We ordered soondae as an appetizer and you kno it's a good Korean restaurant when they give u so many side dishes and if the side dishes are good, it's usually a good indication of how good the food is at the restaurant.  The first time we went, I ordered the jjampong from their dinner menu; my mom ordered the bibimbap; my one sister ordered jjampong like me and my other pregnant sister ordered the Mandu (dumpling) soup. I mean it was all soooo amazing.  So it came as a complete shock n disappointment when we went again this past Thursday and everything was off! My mom, my gf, her mom and I went this time. My gf's mom ordered the galbi soup or . My mom ordered the  spicy beef soup and I ordered the combo: galbi and bibim naeng myun n my gf ordered her jjampong again. Well whatever broth they used for the galbi soup and spicy beef soup was bad!! Like it went sour!!! We could tell right away by the smell and taste that it was bad and the kitchen tried to mask that it went bad by adding tons of salt!! My god!!! Sooo salty!! But even w all that salt you could tell it went bad.   My galbi was extremely salty! Galbi is supposed to b somewhat sweet. Well this one was just straight up salty beef. We ent the galbi soup, my galbi and my mom's spicy beef soup back. They offered us a replacement. So my mom ordered the mandu dumpling soup and I got the spicy tofu soup. Well guess what? Both of them were way too salty and you could smell n taste whatever beef broth they were using, it went bad!! Not sure what happened this time in the kitchen... did the chef leave?? So I ended up eating rice and all the side dishes.   I will try one more time cuz all places could have an off day. So will keep you posted!

mJ3m9i22rVx5BRVdLLoCcA.text: There were 8 of us, & we were able to get a private room. The place is really spacious. Love the staff in this place! Our server was really accommodating when I told him that I'm not too good with spicy food but wanted to try one of the soup options. He requested it without the spice at all. The meat were really tasty. I enjoyed everything. It's a bit pricey, but I didn't mind it for our occasional visit in Phoenix!

tlbW1J46rFxZZ8Tj8KWpaA.text: OMG...FINALLY a real Korean restaurant!!! The "banchan" over a dozen of the chefs hors d oeuvres incredible and free!! We had the chap chae and chicken wings as appetizers  However before we even sat down we were entertained by ALBERT the MAN/Bartender extraordinaire He was delightful and pours a heavy drink if you know what I mean lol Make that a priority to see him first Food was delicious and prepared spot on Make this a must place Aloha Albert!! *i'm  bringing my haole friend (Edward)tomorrow for lunch 1:30 Hope to see you

7JJ03rHLL2Z2fXODH-l2Gw.text: I've been 3 times and I want to keep going back. Everyone is really nice and the food is great. One of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix period. tnbSDP-oTyt9elO30zi-og.text: Loved it! Group of 7 of us went for a weeknight dinner. No wait, great service and delicious food. Everyone ordered a version of the Bibimbap and there were no complaints at our table. The wings were also fantastic. Not all of the side dishes were a hit but with refills of the ones we liked, who cares? Definitely recommend this place!

-SXhT3jxbIk8H-1fyBseMg.text: I have eaten here in a smaller group and the service and experience was great, however today we encompassed 4 large table rooms and we had to ask for water several times before getting it, we didn't get our after meal drink so the 8 people in my section didn't get to experience that wonderful drink.  Food quality and presentation was wonderful. I definitely can't complain about that.

SgWSyIgcVRcU9jjwWvc5SQ.text: Food isnt bad but it's really expensive for what it is. If your familiar with takamatsu it's about the same quality but costs about 40 percent more.   They justify the higher cost by cooking all the meat for you at the grill that is at your table, which isnt something i was a fan of considering I actually like cooking all the meat they bring out and I'm pretty sure my grilling skills are better than my 16 year old waitress.   It's also super awkward when dinner with your girlfriend becomes dinner with your girlfriend and your waiter who's at your table cooking all the meat the entire time.   All the meat and sushi that I ate their was pretty good,  but it isnt any better than anyone else around here and it definitely isnt worth the price.

juBLLnkWe4cjALvG-YI5Pw.text: So, my husband and I went here last night on a fluke. We were supposed to go somewhere else, but the wait was over an hour. This was my first time having Korean BBQ. As soon as we walked in, the place smelled AMAZING! We were greeted right away, and asked to put our name on the list. The place was packed (always a good sign)! We waited maybe a total of 15 minutes. When my husband explained to our server that this was my first time, she was sooo patient with me. She explained every one of the sides and how everything worked. The presentation was beautiful! I'm one who will try anything once, and I enjoyed everything! The food was delicious, the service was excellent, and the entire experience was great! We will DEFINITELY be back!

adzZMUvrUKPf5G_uggK3Zg.text: I would recommend to anyone who is into authentic Korean food, try this place. Great wait staff and you get lot of food so you certainly don't leave hungry.

H-plcB-_172AAROFl5rHQg.text: Great Korean BBQ in a very nicely set up & decorated restaurant. It's not cheap, but the food is excellent & all the food is homemade. The most Authentic Korean we've found in Phoenix. More side dishes served with your BBQ than most Korean restaurants. Service was excellent & we got to chat with the manager which was nice. The only thing I think they could improve is that the BBQ should have been set hotter...to sear the meat.  We really enjoyed our meal and will be back!

5-EolU0T96AW2ALaSWcAWQ.text: This was my second visit to Seoul BBQ and once again it did not disappoint! The food was delicious, still authentic, and the place always looks incredibly clean and modern! One of my favorite things about this Korean restaurant is that they have private party rooms available (view photos to catch a glimpse inside). It is the perfect way to enjoy a private party dinner! They can accommodate small or large parties! The rooms still provide the fun table top grills and you can cook at your table if desired! These private rooms are ideal for business meetings, birthday parties, family gatherings, bachelor party, you name it and it could work! Such a fun idea and concept!  Also, our server Lydia was amazing and so knowledgeable on the menu! She helped us have an amazing experience!

Tb36qT4nRwhsc-R76VDMiQ.text: Nice staff and fun atmosphere. The side dishes are always fresh and the variety changes periodically so that it stays interesting to try every time we go there. Food is very friendly to people who are not so adventurous, too. Tasty  bibimbop and chap chapche always.  Clean bathrooms.  The price is reasonable.

XxP0cKLRUw8IclUb_CAQNw.text: Best Korean BBQ I've had in the valley by a mile. Amazing service and incredible food. The dumplings are homemade and taste it (plus are huge). 7zrcnR2G0hTdNcfp7pzKWA.text: I'm by no means is an expert on Korean food having just been introduced recently to the joys of this amazing cuisine, but I know good food and this  is good food.   The restaurant is clean, well decorated with friendly and helpful staff. I've seen a few comments about the servers not knowing about the menu, but  the times I've visited, they've offered suggestions and answered questions. In addition, other servers will help as you need and are very accommodating.  I was surprised when I got a lunch special (I had the bibimap and my friend had the dol-sat bibimap) and we were presented with soup and the sides. I didn't realize that a lunch special would include sides and it was very happy about that because the sides are amazing and one of the perks of Korean food. Our server even brought us more sweet potatoes because they were so good.  Both of our dishes were amazing. The flavors are just perfect in their dishes. Honestly, a few days after my visit, I was craving it again. This is going to be my weekly lunch place.  As far as cost, yes, the lunch special was $11. However, it's a LOT of food. That one lunch gave me two more days of leftovers. For me, the quality of the food is definitely worth it.  And if you can't handle chopsticks (c'mon, give it a try), just request a fork. ;)

AqYbIagkDZYY2Qw4Q5CsDg.text: I went here with a friend during a trip and it was outstanding. I love Korean food, and this is some of the best I've ever had. The food was delicious and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I highly recommend the chicken wings, jam bong and the kalbi jim. I also tried this drink with soju and a melon bar in it. I can't remember what it's called, but it was so good!

m5k2BcpmKvy16e04sTSWLg.text: It's expensive, yes. But the service is great they are very friendly and inform you of all the menu items. Their quality of meat is great.  They give sooo many side dishes and they are delicious my daughter loves the pancake there. Defiantly one of our favorite places .

cZJpyn1KA-kR-ml7woDBSQ.text: Over price, pay 60 for two persons. It fine if the food it good. And on top of that, the service it bad. EHWO2LV-LuO_1YrpshN6qg.text: We had a great time eating. The servers were friendly and attentive. The portions were good sized and their hot tea (Boricha) helped digesting our food. OUjNOalBvBL0dPtSGOaK2w.text: This place is amazing! We met the owner right after we ordered our food, what a great and nice guy. One thing I could say about this spot is once you go you're gonna want to come back, I know I will for sure.

53Dq1jRPLczrQ0KP_--rZA.text: Even the coke tastes better here! My friend and I have found our newest obsession. I'm not Korean but I've spent a significant amount of time in Korea, and this place is legit. SIXTEEN banchan (side dishes), a giant serving of delicious bulgogi, and a steaming plate of mandu and I'm so full I can't imagine ever eating again. The super friendly owner, Albert, stopped by our table to chat with us and make sure everything was good but it wasn't--it was GREAT!!

dz7FFmRQDSTNRgKQYZh8Ww.text: Excellent food, grate ambience and service. Grateful that there is one more option in the culinary art. Fantastic to enjoy with the family or with your partner.

vA0mwOChoEtYDC0EVeoKBg.text: Having lived in South Korea, we are always on the lookout for authentic and delicious Korean food here in the US. We heard about this place from a Korean friend who raved about it, so we decided to check it out and are so glad we did. When we walked in they didn't have a table available so we decided to head to the bar and grab a drink while we waited. The bartender that evening turned out to be one of the owners, who absolutely made our experience amazing. He mixed us drinks per our own tastes and then even invented a drink for us to try later on.  The food was delicious and authentic to our experiences in Korea. Lots of delicious varieties of pickled sides, hard to find here in Phoenix. If you haven't had the experience of True Korean BBQ before, this is a great place to start. The staff will walk you through everything. We had a very memorable night and will definitely be back!

uaL9PkygWs3vfXMSSW4FOw.text: Family went to dinner and we ordered 5 dishes. The fried rice was good but not enough meat to eat the rice with. They forgot about my dumplings and it wasn't even worth the wait. They were way too oily. The California roll was good.  The beef bone soup and the beef rice combo was not that great. Also the food is SUPER pricey and you can get a better deal at an all-you-can-eat buffet.

J_XWptO5_vDLhi7Cg0BjhQ.text: I have tried the sushi and the ribeye and chicken BBQ here and all of it was quite good. The service was also impeccable and the setting is very nice and clean. It is definitely a pricey place. For two adults and a kid, we ended up spending $100 and we didn't even order drinks. They also don't have a kid friendly menu at all. Luckily, my 6 yo will eat rice and liked the chicken, so she shared with us. It is definitely an authentic place. Most of the "sides" I wasn't too crazy about and it was a bit overwhelming. You get 16 small dishes of them! To be honest, I had no idea what most of them were. I did try almost all of them and a couple of them were good. Not sure how often I will go back, but it was a very cool experience.

I31fvFEXOS1qOcZqbVbXbg.text: Absolutely wonderful.  Service a little slow but they were jammed.  Best Korean food!!!!  We'll be back!

tYGJzyL0NpOchOSkiKaPVQ.text: First time there. Food was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Answered any questions you may have. Definitely will eat there again.

qf1iUJOArzDWu-joi2hnFA.text: Best Korean Restaurant I've tried outside of Korea. I travel all of the US and frequent Korean restaurants with my Korean friends. I had the Kalbi Tang for lunch (beef short rib soup). The side dishes were fantastic, and the service was great. In town for the week and will definitely go back for seconds (Korean BBQ next time, it looked so good). Go visit for yourself; you won't be disappointed. Seoul BBQ and Sushi!!!!!!!

RoQpz3IWisKiPMptCdzObg.text: Great cuts of meat for the BBQ! Everything was tender! Can't go wrong with anything there! We were a party of 4 and chose the 5 meat combo! Such a great deal! Will be coming back soon and it's my new place to go!

GIrtKSgq-iyry36r2j1Azg.text: What an amazing experience! The pride the owners and staff feel for this restaurant is palpable and truly evident in the food and service. Our dinner was absolutely delicious and it was so much fun to watch our food being cooked in front of us while tasting all the yummy traditional side dishes!! We cannot wait to return and would recommend this fabulous restaurant to all!! Bring the whole family and enjoy a very special dining experience!!!

ih8tT5gWdPQNjnI7gqyREg.text: Best Korean Restaurant since leaving Hawaii. So good and so much food! Bringing everyone I know to this place.

pvV-3l_nRXloaaM00ClhDw.text: We made a reservation. Got right in at the time of it, and got drinks right away. The service was excellent and the food was even better. Nick was our server. Very polite and knowledgeable about any questions we had. Will be going back!

iRdKIsaxHloDtlWaAsvZew.text: Food is great and service is excellent.  This place offers by far the best Korean side dishes, both in terms of quality and variety.  They rotate the options often, and I'm always looking forward to the pleasant surprises in side dishes.

SESXmnP6C1RGWqRgdAj7kw.text: This place is great! The traditional Korean dishes are very flavorful. Many dishes come with a small dish appetizer assortment, that any foodie is sure to appreciate. Give it a try and I'm sure you'd want to come back by like we do. We had a few extra apps., niguri, and some Korean beef dishes. Everything was prepared very well.

kKn60eYN9CoeUlWrEf3XeQ.text: Surprised to find some of the best Korean food I have ever eaten in Phoenix of all places.  Traveling from Chicago on golf trip and managed to find this gem.  Will definitely be back next time I am in town.

jN-BStS_RDXQkshmqgqz2g.text: This is the best Korean Restaurant I've ever had.  The Kalbi Jim was unbelievable, and the chicken wings were amazing.  We ate outside in the Patio and the service was very good here.

fzcPZF6qzEJSpwQX5J9HCw.text: Excellent! My wife and I loved the food and service. The place is very well decorated too. Come eat here.

Ak_v5QrTHFThbH9Km6BLUA.text: Most excellent, a must for visiting guest, families and friends. Great customer service, beautiful and clean dining establishment. I am Korean, the food is authentic with flavors of mom's kitchen. Wide variety of Korean cuisine, sushi bar, you can choose to grill your own or have prepared foods brought to your table. Best in Phoenix so far! Will be bringing all my family and friends. Gahm sa hamni da!

cSehgBuav4AOCLklzMGt1g.text: Awesome Place!! Food is excellent along with the service. We were greeted by the hostess and seated right away. She took the time to explain the menu to us and made some recommendations,( unlike another Korean place I know on thunderbird). The free appetizers came out right away and not soon after our dishes. Our server was extremely polite and attentive.  My wife had never tried Korean and loved it. I have eaten at other Korean places in the valley and this is the best. I did not sample the Sushi or Shashimi but there were plenty of choices. We will be back soon.

aKYPrTbcbM0yxEqwQ6T7Jg.text: I eat here at least once a week usually for lunch. The staff is always very friendly/attentive, the food is always amazing and the value is perfect. From soup at the beginning, to the bento boxes, bbq, sushi, or hot noodles to the sikhye at the end of every meal everything is always delicious. I will recommend the la galbi as it is my favorite but anything you get will be delicious.

ONQJeVMI1fRgVuKZuU6jqg.text: We got the soon tofu soup and the gom tang. Both were pretty ok nothing special. We also got the strawberry shaved ice and that was delicious . I didn't see it on the menu but they had a banner for it in front of the restaurant and it was $7.99. The service was kind of weird since we had about 4 different waiters. It was fine since they have a button to press if we needed them and just assumed its who ever can help at the time. They also had a new lunch menu.

kE46J4xMDwoKuWlBWGSKOg.text: We decided to try this place while on a double date. I'm happy that it's so much closer to home and I can get my kbbq fix more often. The restaurant is clean, updated, and a lot bigger than I thought it would be (insert a Dr Who 'it's bigger on the inside clip'). However, like all kbbq places, it is pricey. We ordered the combination D which is $139.99 before tax and tip. However, the amount of food and the quality of meat are worth it. Every meat we ordered was amazing quality- very tender and flavorful. The marinades didn't overpower the taste of the meat like at some places. They'll even cook the meat for you or help you if you ask. The portions were decent too. The meal doesn't stop there though! We also had a crazy amount of banchan, soup (2 options), rice, scallion pancake, shumai, and lettuce to make wraps. They also gave us sesame oil and an amazing ginger dressing to dip meat in. I was very fat and happy by the time we finished dinner. However, there were a couple of hiccups during our meal. I chalk it up to an inexperienced waiter or maybe too many things to remember to bring to the table? Whatever the reason, our meat was brought out but the sides had been forgotten. We were quickly brought the banchan- my favorites were the potato salad and the pickled veggies. However, we had to ask again for rice, another time for our soup, and different time for any sauces (we originally asked for a dressing for the salad since it was just plain shredded lettuce and carrots in a bowl). Even though service wasn't smooth, it was quickly fixed by either our waiter or the owner. Both were incredibly quick to bring us any refills we asked for or anything we were missing. The owner was amazingly nice and respectful and that by itself earned a star from me.

photos.caption: Photo of Seoul BBQ & Sushi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aDpIKaqIChyQGooiyb-8Yw.text: Saw this place as we drove and decided to stop in! So glad we did it was delicious! Table Bbq and sushi we got sushi and it was amazing! A little pricey but worth EVERY penny!

D_FGUL8WAvYkzq6ez17wcg.text: First time here. There seems to be plenty of Korean BBQ restaurants in the Sun City / Peoria / Phoenix area, but few have the selection of Traditional Korean Soups and Dishes available at this restaurant. And man where they delicious!! The soups, side dishes, and the shaved ice were on point!! Coming here with these excellent traditional dishes made our night and some place we'll definitely come back to. If you're in the area, and wanting great traditional Korean soups - this is your spot!!

aJZ2ha5Oex-4xJQPBDtOXg.text: This is the best KBBQ place I've ever had in AZ!! KBBQ is always gonna be on the moderately priced side but you get what you pay for!! Since this isn't an All You Can Eat place you can take home the left overs which we LOVED!! The gave us this type of drink at the end to help with digestion and it really worked. They have a great variety of meats to choose from. Personally, I wouldn't get appetizers bc the meat will fill you up along with all of the sides you get! The serve situation is very traditional korean restaurant style. We only saw our original server when he took our food order and when he gave us our check. All of the servers work together and make sure everyone is okay but never the less just use the bell that's next to your table if needed! It comes in helpful. They also turn on the grill for you- I don't have a gas grill so I'm unaware of how to use one but it's great! I'd recommend this place to everyone!

37bnoF9vVe23w6gMztX7NA.text: Super delicious. Good sized portions. Lots of side dishes. Great service. Will be back for sure!

wGF25G24gJjY0NFN4qPe9g.text: FANTASTIC! I can not recommend Seoul enough. The quality of the food was tremendous and our server, Kim, graciously explained everything for us as it was our first time to a Korean BBQ restaurant. Great service, great food, and an upscale yet casual atmosphere. They definitely went above and beyond our expectations!

ONdUy3Z8URitGEMusLaFNQ.text: This place is huge and well designed so I thought the food would be amazing, too. NOPE! The galbi was incredibly fatty and the soondae we ordered was dry and flavorless. The ddukboki wasn't the typical ddukboki you'd expect, either. But what's worse was the service. Our server was bringing the meat combo platter over when he dropped a few pieces of meat on the floor. Naturally, one would replace that but he never brought out more. Why wouldn't you replace the meat YOU DROPPED?? I had to ask two different people four different times for a straw, dirty dishes didn't get cleared, and overall the service just sucked. There are soooo many good Korean restaurants in Phoenix and surrounding areas. I would never recommend this place to anyone.

FERolaeQAhPs7v4Ig0sFSw.text: Legitimately the best Korean restaurant in Phoenix. Authentic food, new and gorgeous building, and friendly staffs. omMAyGeb1yTGvv-kHwR8JA.text: Tried this place during a business meeting, really nice place, great for big parties. Expect to pay any where from $60-200+ depending on you group size. You do get a lot of food when ordering combos, ours came with 2 sides, and rice for everyone. My co-workers and I, had the combo that was enough for 3-4 people. We order LA Galbi (marinated short rib on bone), Bulgogi (marinated rib eye), and Dak Bulgogi (marinated chicken spicy. The combo came with a Hot Pot which was cooked egg broth, and the Yachae Jeon(a veggie pancake). We were then able to pick two appetizers with this combo , we chose Jalapeno Bombers and Edamame. Other Korean BBQ places usually have 4-5 sides of different kimchi or pickled veggies. Here they give you over 8 different ones and explain each one, which is awesome if it's your first time. For fountain drinks they have coke products. They also have tea that isn't sweetened, but you can also add flavors to it like raspberry. Even had boba! The staff was super attentive and really helpful. Again the set up was great for all group sizes, but even better if you have a group of 6+. Highly recommend for birthdays or just a night out.
