3bfOdK3Fo4Jxz8uSa35f9Q.text: Excellent Korean Food!  I often drive North on I-17 and see their sign "coming soon". Finally after a couple of months they have opened. My wife and I tried this place for the first time yesterday. Although we are a takeout kind of couple I was impressed when we walked into the restaurant. Very clean. The decor provides an appealing display of their Korean heritage. Conservative, but beautiful. I was greeted promptly and (I should have got her name. but I think she is part-owner) an eagerness to answer any questions. My wife and I are Korean food veterans.  There are few Korean restaurants in Phoenix. We have tried most of them. This is by far the best. What we ordered: Lunch portions Mandu - Excellent. Not from a freezer. LARGE. One order would be enough for a good meal.  Shumai - Also made from scratch. Very tasty.  Beef bulgogi - haven't had this combination of flavors for so long. Wonderful marinade to go along with a nice char taste. The beef is lean and the serving is generous.  Spicy chicken - Oh my (). You better like heat and have rice nearby to take away the initial sting. I didn't expect it would be that hot. Although I really enjoyed this dish. Again, very nice portion.  Dinner portions  Kimchi-jiige - Very spicy. Excellent flavored soup. Lots of vegetables.  Chapchae - Over-the-top! Very authentic. If my wife says it's good food. It's good.  The different side dishes provided were kimchee and various pickled or preserved vegetables. Not frozen. Not prepacked. Presented beautifully.  I will be going back.

ON6CYo2TTTB0Jy3_L7vWCA.text: Sort Story - Last Time every thing was AMAZING and EVERYTHING exceeded my expectations.   This time average...................  In case you don't know...Seoul BBQ & Sushi is a large Korean Restaurant that offers a Large Korean Menu with Korean BBQ Combos. This is an attractive nice looking restaurant.  We enjoyed ourselves so much last time we couldn't wait to come back again soon to try the BBQ Combo.   Last time they started us off with 17 DELICIOUS side dishes and told us what they were. This was so GREAT last time...These were the BEST side dishes I ever had at a Korean Restaurant!  This time we were served 8 side dishes that didn't seem as flavorful or fresh and nobody told us what they were. I saw one side dish that was different and asked what it was and I was told it was a root. My husband tried it and told me it was a very fishy fish.... ;(   Next we were served a salad that was slightly BROWN    :(  Then our Bulgogi comes out and is being cooked for us. The meat was very tasty and was made with a delicious marinade but didn't get any caramelization....It came out sort of braised.  The Rib was prepared a little better and did get a little caramelization. It didn't seem like the best quality because it was a little chewy with some gristle.  Last time our plates were cleared.  This time we just looked a big pile of dirty plates.  I will be generous  with the rating since they are new and still working things out.  This restaurant really has SO MUCH POTENTIAL! I really enjoyed everything so much on my first visit!  I hope to enjoy the menu again!

9CBMRj7fyMXrypOPfZJ-NQ.text: Arrived at 5 pm (party of 4) on a Wednesday night. Only tables, no booths because in order to cook at your table you need the "cooker" in the middle of the table. Restaurant was less than 1/3 full. Seated and had 3 different persons ask us what we wanted to drink. Push drinks cause you make over 100% on profit. Try water with lemon and add sugar to hold you over and not have to pay over $2+ for ice tea and $4-5 for draft. The good part, large selection. The bad part, the prices are too high. Food was average, found nothing special in taste. Had 4 different items and dinners and everyone agree, too expensive.  Dinners are $34-$39 dollars. I have been to other locations in the valley that offer the same menu at a lot less $$$. Will I return, don't think so.

2ldt-L_Rx626d5qa-6-X1w.text: Been twice.  Both on Saturday nights.  Both visits were perfect.  Great food and staff. Lots of banchan to choose from. Narrowed them down to my 5 favorites to reduce the banchan table clutter and make more room for other food.  The decor is clean and modern.

_3urzQHh-4qlZtrhcyjY-A.text: First time here, we ordered family combo. It supposed to be a meal for two. Meal came from bunch of appetizers, which includes all Korean side dishes, vegetable pancake, shumai l, a choice of soup from a list and salad. As for meat it comes with Kalbi and a choice of meat from a list. We chose bulkogi.  Remember, it supposed to be a MEAL FOR TWO. NOT AT ALL! It's meal for 4 for sure!! You will get tons of food! Everything tasted yummy! Service was great too but I didn't like server cooked meat for us. We would rather do it by ourselves. And server shut the grill off quickly... We even wondered if they were trying to save on gas. lol We wish we had more control.  Overall, good food and good service. But not cheap. I don't like spicy at all. I wish I was able to choose non spicy soup. I had macaroon ice steam, which was ok. Macaroon was so sweet so I did not taste ice cream well. Including tip, we paid almost $100. Would we come back? Definitely! But next time with more people.

Csq8O1kW1m18ThV2wlNZIw.text: This is the best Korean restaurant I have eaten in Phoenix. The fried dumplings are to die for. They are pretty big size. I had the seafood soup my favorite. I definitely will come back!

uM7I7jqVlvM3xv14p_3oUw.text: The Naengmyeon on the other hand is a cold dish.  The color was clear with hint of amber but to taste it was icy cold, refreshing and just a little bite from the mustard I added. The fresh made noodles were thin and had the appropriate wonderfully firm texture.  I drank in the broth then went to town on the noodles with the accompanying seasoned radish and cucumbers. I loved lots of small dishes.

XajLeVuNIaCdwHpJmJ7kNw.text: Soooooooo good!!! Love this place! Went for Valentine's Day with my girlfriend and left so satisfied

Z9WtHwZdaC2jrHzLHioUVg.text: If you enjoy Korean food you need to come here!  This was our first time, but I was so impressed with the experience I wanted  to yelp about them!  We were driving down from Flagstaff to Sky Harbor and in the mood for ramen, but all the Japanese places were closed (for July 4th).  Looking through Yelp my attention immediately went to their hot pots and stews.  So we decided to have Korean instead and so glad we did!  I was impressed with the obvious care taken to the surroundings, service and food.  The restaurant is spacious, modern, and clean.  You tap the service button at your table when you're ready to order.  Our server was polite and efficient and brought out the banchan shortly after we ordered.  There were 16 dishes -- I think I squealed when he kept laying down dish after dish! For two people that is an impressive number of banchan!  They even had soy braised eggs which I never see outside of Taiwanese places!  What was notable to my husband and I though was the different layers of spice and flavors in their kimchee.  We've had plenty of kimchi where all you taste is the heat and nothing else or just the acid, but their kimchee (today cabbage, radish, two types of cucumbers and baby bok choy) all tasted unique and balanced with varying levels of heat.  I generally don't tolerate a ton of spice and some of their kimchee was fairly spicy, but it was a controlled, enjoyable heat. Fantastic!  My husband ordered the kimchee jjigae and I had the soon tofu combo.  My dish could be ordered mild, spicy or "white seasoning" (no spice at all).  I decided no spice because I wanted to taste the underlying flavors and I've been disappointed in places where mild=too spicy.  This dish is delicious comfort food at its best with the silkiest homemade tofu in a rich, complex flavored broth mingled with a poached egg, nappa, mussels, clams, and shrimp bubbling in a hot pot and so good I could eat it everyday.  I was so stuffed after this and the rice and the banchan, but I kept eating because everything tasted sooo good.  We will definitely be coming back!  They also have sushi and of course Korean bbq which I can't wait to try.

l0-w2YADHtiJXen1_7VzWg.text: Food was incredible and service was superb. Waiter did forget one of our orders but brought it promptly to us and offered a discount!

tikgKRHOHoZrDvy38wCJew.text: Love this cute affordable sushi spot! Happy hour is super affordable and staff if so friendly! Owner always offer free ice cream to my kids and that if their favorite part of this experience!

Zu3NUBSGvIQnIeHS8oGPew.text: So my meal was actually very satisfying to say the least but I called ahead just to get an explanation of how many meats and to see what the ratio would be since we where going on an empty stomach after a long movie. I got told that the meal that you would pay $140 for would come with 8 meats no less then 16oz of serving per meat so that's over 8lbs seems like more then enough. But turns out to be wrong you only get 5 meats. Also if they mess up and not bring out the rice you'll get told very nicely that rice is complimentary that you dont get charged for the rice. If that was the case then rice would be all you can eat not get charged extra for extra rice like the menu says. Honestly we had to guess what the 14 side dishes where and wait to for a server to ask. I had 3 kids with me 2 under the age of 3 and 1 that is 7 and they get included as guest so they made sure they take 18% gratuity so I ended paying $321 for 8 people that included a $45 gratuity. Idk will have to reconsider visiting this place again or go elsewhere. But to the cooks of all my extra stuff like the veggie pancake and sushi and my appetizers thank you cause everything was enjoyable thanks to y'all.

Qe42qJH5JJXKC63shvaJ9A.text: This is a new restaurant with upscale interior. Plenty of seats inside. I ordered about 6 different dishes to try out (and free side dishes). They are sweeter side and dishes come quickly. One thing that I noticed is their service and price.  Again this is a new restaurant where their service staffs still need to get trained (some of them are new). They are friendly though.  Price of dishes that I ordered (BBQ for 5 to 6 people, seafood pancake and more) are pricier and small quantity (particularly BBQ).   There are other Korean restaurants who provide similar or better taste of authentic Korean dishes with a reasonable price in Phoenix and Mesa area. It happened to my friend who took her friends to this restaurant and got surprised by the price.   Parking: Free and plenty of spaces Service: Friendly but need to improve Price: High for what they provide compare other Korean restaurants in this area Recommendation: Try Jjangbong (Spicy seafood noodle soup)

DAvsDMA7Q6nibeHSM_8ECw.text: Servers were very nice and pleasant checking with us several times during dinner.  I had a lot of Korean living with a Korean gf and her many friends.  I would rate the food average to above average.  I rate the prices EXTREMELY high.  An example fried rice at $ 11.99.  In fact Yelp needs to add another $ to their pricing header.    Overall a disappointment.

Ga4I5-kIZWyBXvOggJ1xJw.text: Extremely unpleasant experience from the moment we sat down, we should have walked out when we saw the prices. The menu is incredibly intimidating. The dinner comes with "14 sides" that they would not tell you what they were till they arrived, all of which looked inedible. Once they described the "sides" they then sounded inedible. The meat that arrived looked rancid, and once cooking started smelled rancid. The rice that arrived in a tiny bowl, was marked as an extra cost if you wanted more.... more PLAIN WHITE RICE was extra!!   Once the first round of meat was cooked the flavor was ok, but I would have expected fantastic for the price. I will not be back.

ntEaRfPWLlS0rD7ucs0LOw.text: We had our first dinner here tonight and it was fantastic!  The sushi rolls were top of the line, the entree was flavorful and amazing, with great service and tastes all around.  It's upscale with an extensive menu and full bar.  Each table is equipped with a personal BBQ grill if you choose that option.  We will be back for sure.

avFk6zZfh8QArfL0rhR0Pg.text: My wife and I had dinner here because of the good reviews and convenient location. I could not have been happier. We sat at the bar that was tended by the owner, who was gracious, kind, and incredibly friendly--a real asset to the community. The menu is extensive, but we were strictly looking for Korean food on this visit. My wife had been stationed in Korea, and had not been able to find her favorite dish since she'd gotten back years ago. This place had it! Dokbokki and Goon Man-Du appetizers filled us up, but I wished I'd ordered another dish to take home. We will definitely be back, the restaurant is very nice, good ambience, attentive staff, any kind of authentic Asian food you could want, and very accommodating. They even have Japanese, Chinese, and Korean beer!

L4mvy26WiF9nmFqYgWW0vQ.text: WORST experience EVER. Ordered 4 different rolls of sushi and an order of Beef bulgogi. The orders of sushi came out looking like as if a 5 year old child rolled it and make it for us. The rice of the sushi was falling apart before it got to the table and all the fish looked squished and not fresh (the fish had a very dull color) Thats the even the worst part of this experience. The bulgogi we ordered came out on a "sizzling" plate but the meat was completely cold and I mean COLD! The server brought this cold bulgogi back to the kitchen and said they will make a fresh bulgogi for us. 15 mins later they brought us a plate of OBVIOUSLY spicy marinaded CHICKEN and told us that is the beef bulgogi. The audacity of this place... 10/10 would NOT recommend.

xu5FbB7RMpeGODTl4xn0ug.text: Ok this is the Korean BBQ spot for us! My mom is from South Korea and was visiting us from California and this was our last night together. I'm so glad we went here, the food was great (just read the other reviews here!) and the service was great too- I have to applaud the young gentlemen in training (I forget his name but I think he was the manager's son) for handling all our requests, letting us know what all the dishes were and even grilling all the meat for us! -Normally when I've been to Korean BBQ houses, they start it off and then leave, but our waiter was so attentive and switched out the pan right when the first round of meat was done.  Oh and the shaved ice-cream deserts - :0! I've never had it that style before. Usually the base is plain shaved ice but this place mixes it with condensed milk so it's like a fine, light ice cream with toppings. I can't wait to have it again!

0D8FEKtmwXnrM8tpeMZZXg.text: Took the wife and kid to try out the new Korean BBQ in town. The atmosphere was very nice, services was really quick, and they have a pretty big menu. The wait staff was really attentive and answer all of our questions. The food was really good,  it I think they are slightly over price. The wife and I both agree, the food was amazing. The best we've tasted around. They have some really unique dishes, that i haven't seen around the Phoenix area. This place would have gotten a five star, if they would have boxed out meal for us. It was kind of difficult for us to box soup and ensure our son was turning in the gas grill at the table.   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

eGGAofN1CwwEf9NeyXYLkQ.text: This place charges you double the price compared to actual authentic Korean food from CALIFORNIA. $30 for a single serving of galbi jjim, $20 for galbi tang with a small bug in it, and no sauce to dip the meat in?! No thanks. Their only saving grace was that the flavor of the broth was decent and the variety of side dishes. However, no one came to replace them, despite being "unlimited". No wonder this place was empty during dinner time on a holiday. I won't be coming back.

EmN9YOttaI2Llg3U4H1wWg.text: Great food and great service.  A bit priced more than regular ayce.  Good spread of Banchan.  Servers actually serve you by helping you cook your meats, although I prefer to cook myself.  No dipping sauces but didn't need it. I wished there was rice paper.

H9cu8SADMYRV91eRIDb5uQ.text: What a great dinning experience! We were visiting Phoenix with our dog so we wanted a restaurant with a patio. Seoulphx has a lovely patio (also beautiful inside) and while we couldn't have BBQ on the patio, the menu is amazing with tons of other options! We both ordered from the soups and stews section. I had the JJamppong that was packed with a bounty of seafood delights in the most wonderful broth and my husband had the Samgyettag. Both were absolutely delicious and served with at least a dozen traditional Korean side dishes that were so yummy! The service was great, friendly and prompt. We can't wait to go again without our dog so we can sit inside and try the BBQ.

DZ1z8cKQlxtlTCUAOyFnqQ.text: Me and my brother and friend went to Seoul for dinner as we've been wanting to try this place since we have gone to GEN in Tempe and usually go to that location for Korean BBQ. Seoul phx BEATS GEN by so many ways. They explain everything they are giving you and if you have questions they have an answer for you. The food is delicious and the service is great. The only reason why I would give a 4 star is the price and the meats that come in groups should have more of a variety. Thank you for a great night Seoul!

I4GX5p7NeaAiR15yxcfRHg.text: Great experience!  We knew nothing about Korean barbecue or food but decided to check this place out.  Very clean and classy ambience. The staff was so friendly and helpful!  They made great recommendations and explained all of the dishes.  Food was great with fresh barbecue cooked at your table and a multitude of side dishes.  We will definitely be back!

-XFLoTzwxbsb_odOTieJAQ.text: Went in for Father's Day with 6 adults and 4 kids ranging from 1-4 years old. We had a private room, which was perfect. All the food was amazing and the service was on point. The owner was very accommodating and really friendly. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in the mood for Korean BBQ!

UumJp_Md6d4w-0avEuQtbw.text: I love Korean BBQ! This is absolutely one of the best places I've been to. The private rooms are a huge plus for both business and family. I'm an Asian and can testify it's a great place to go!

The drinks are some of the best I've had ( I love a good sweet drink). The 20 something side dishes are amazing too!

ESW2IEOU19i7_HGWLkqeHg.text: I love this korean BBQ. This is the best I've ever been to, and the food there is great. The service was perfect  I felt welcomed

l5x4x8ppzc5xNAY4c_zoQg.text: So gross. Super long wait time just to get your food. No way to eat there on your lunch break and even if you get take out it takes more then 30 min to get. Was excited to try and wish I didn't.

1nPeqGVC31nEIX4kHii4Kw.text: My husband and I ate lunch here on a Friday.  We chose this place because it was supposedly a BBQ house, and we both really enjoy the experience of table-grilling.  However, table-grilling is not available at lunch, but I don't recall the menu stating that and the waitress said nothing either when we placed our order for BBQ pork and BBQ beef.  And I even told the person who seated us that we there for the BBQ. The pre-cooked BBQ plates came with 8 sides dishes, and we also ordered a plate of fried shiumai as an appetizer.  Everything tasted fine but portions were quite dinky, and the $2 charge for extra orders of rice or sides seems highly unreasonable.  Our bill came to $34 with tax+tip (without beverages), and I was hungry again a few hours later.  Overall just mediocre value for the money here so probably no return trip anytime soon.

UqUC0z-EzKr5jMSkSPth0g.text: This is not an all you can eat place and not a chain either! There are not many great restaurant options in our neighborhood so this was a real treat! The interior is classy and HUGE! We sat at the Sushi Bar and Alex was our chef.  Everything we ordered was delicious!  They have a full bar with lots of top shelf options, including a wide variety of Sake.  Our next trip to Seoul will be for the Korean BBQ.. Thanks for the great service Alex, see you next time!

PcFloB4MKBZwr08ByIq_HA.text: been there twice first time was served spoiled meat and then next time was served spoiled side dish a person came over and tried explain why she thinks it was spoiled but never replaced. service was terrible and menu is way over-priced deserve 0 star!!!!
